0.title: 1 killed, 2 injured as under-construction building falls in Pune
0.article_body: A labourer was killed and two others were injured after an under-construction building collapsed in Pune's Kiwale village. The deceased labourer has been identified as 26-year-old Sandeep Balsingh from Jharkhand. "The construction workers were working at a site around 30 feet deep inside for a basement construction when a part of huge debris suddenly fell on them," said police.

1.title: I don't think we'll see Umran Malik playing in 2nd T20I vs SA: Jaffer
1.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said it's unlikely that pacer Umran Malik will make his India debut in the second T20I against South Africa. "It would be unfair to change the team after one game...Since it's a five-game series, there are always chances of getting opportunities later," he stated. India lost the first T20I by seven wickets.

2.title: Competed with Salman for 'Maine...', discussions were on to launch me: Deepak
2.article_body: Actor-Director Deepak Tijori said he and actor Salman Khan had auditioned for role of 'Prem' in the movie 'Maine Pyar Kia'. "Salman and I were only...people who were competing for the role of Prem, neck-to-neck...They had even told me that if they selected me...they'd like to change my name on...screen and discussed how they'd like to launch me," Tijori added.

3.title: Shaan said 'Don't come in big cars, come in autos, people will give work': Mika
3.article_body: Singer Mika Singh said that when he was new, singer Shaan had told him to not come in big cars "because one doesn't get work". "[He said] 'You simply come in autos...people will give you work'. I thought I had to change things...That a singer shouldn't only be seen in singing shows but should get opportunities everywhere," Mika added.

4.title: BJP will be in Guinness Book for paper leaks: Kejriwal in Himachal
4.article_body: Addressing a gathering at Himachal Pradesh's Hamirpur, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "The BJP government will be in the Guinness Book of World Records for paper leaks...during its rule." Kejriwal said, "I don't understand why papers are being leaked in Gujarat, Haryana and Himachal." He added, "Why doesn't it happen in our Delhi?"

5.title: We don't need Nupur Sharma's apology: Owaisi on Prophet remark row
5.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said there is no need to seek an apology from Nupur Sharma over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad since an FIR has been filed against her. "Law will take its own course," Owaisi said. Criticising Jharkhand's government over violence on Friday, he said, "There was firing on people in Ranchi, this shouldn't have happened."

6.title: Nadda meets envoys of 13 countries as part of 'Know BJP' initiative
6.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda interacted with envoys of 13 countries at the party headquarters in Delhi, where he informed them about the party's ideology, history and ongoing activities. This is the fourth such event held by the BJP President. The interaction was a part of the 'Know BJP' initiative which was launched on BJP's foundation day on April 6.

7.title: Strict action must be taken against hatemongers: Sachin Pilot
7.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot said strict action must be taken against those spreading hate in society. Reacting to comments over Prophet Muhammad, he said that the Centre wasn't bothered when people of the country demanded action against the spokesperson but was prompt in doing so when foreign countries issued denunciations. Pilot also criticised the Centre over rising inflation and unemployment.

8.title: 30 Army personnel named in chargesheet filed over death of civilians in Nagaland
8.article_body: Thirty Indian Army personnel have been named in the chargesheet filed in the connection to the botched security operation in Nagaland's Mon that led to the death of 13 civilians in December 2021. The personnel belonging to 21 Para Special Forces didn't follow the SOP and the Rules of Engagement and resorted to "indiscriminate and disproportionate firing", an SIT alleged.

9.title: Depp's fans criticise Amber for flying in private jet after lawyer said she can't pay $10mn
9.article_body: Actress Amber Heard was spotted for the first time since the verdict was announced in Johnny Depp's defamation trial. She was clicked stepping out of a private airplane. "If you can afford that, you can afford to pay what you owe Johnny," a tweet read. Her attorney had said she "absolutely cannot" pay the $10 million she owes Johnny now.

10.title: Sitharaman inaugurates GST museum installed in 400-yr-old building in Goa
10.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Saturday inaugurated 'Dharohar', the National Museum of Customs and GST in Goa. The two-storey building is over 400 years old. It showcases artefacts seized by Indian Customs, including the manuscript of Ain-i-Akbari and replica of Amin pillars. It houses the 'Battle of Wits' gallery, showcasing the cerebral battle between smugglers and Customs officers.

11.title: Past decade saw increase in number of women voters: Book
11.article_body: The number of women voters in India has increased over the past decade, according to a new book released. Till 2010, the number of women voters was less than men, Sanjay Kumar, who edited Women Voters in Indian Elections - Changing Trends and Emerging Patterns, said. In 2019 general election, men and women voted in nearly equal numbers, he added.

12.title: World's smallest singer performs at AR Rahman's daughter's wedding reception
12.article_body: A video has shown music composer AR Rahman listening to the world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik performing 'Papa Kehte Hain' at the former's daughter's wedding reception. The video was shared by the Tajik singer on his Instagram page with the caption "Godfather". The reception for Rahman's daughter Khatija and son-in-law Riyasdeen Shaik Mohamed was held in Chennai on Friday.

13.title: Indian startup FarEye fires 250 workers globally ahead of appraisal: Report
13.article_body: Indian logistics startup FarEye has laid off as many as 250 employees globally ahead of their appraisal, as per reports. The startup's Co-Founder and CEO Kushal Nahata cited the "softness in market conditions" as the reason behind this move. In 2021, Nahata said FarEye aimed to become a unicorn in 6-12 months after raising $100 million in series E funding.

14.title: Contain Tamil Nadu's COVID-19 spread: CM MK Stalin tells officials
14.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Saturday said measures should be taken to contain the spread of coronavirus in the state and facilities to treat affected patients should be kept ready, in view of rising cases. Stalin, who chaired a meeting to review the COVID-19 situation, advised various departments and local administration to join hands in containing the COVID-19 spread.

15.title: 42-year-old man kills sister over property dispute in Ahmedabad
15.article_body: A 42-year-old man, Madan Singh, allegedly stabbed his younger sister to death over a property dispute in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Friday. Police said the incident occurred around 2 am when Madan Singh stabbed his sister and injured his father and nephew when they tried to prevent him. A murder case has been filed against Singh, who is currently absconding.

16.title: 2 terrorists killed in separate encounters in J&K's Kulgam, Pulwama
16.article_body: Two terrorists were killed in two separate encounters with security forces in J&K's Kulgam and Pulwama districts on Saturday, police said. Arms and ammunition, including a rifle along with 23 rounds and a hand grenade, were recovered from the encounter site in Kulgam, an official said. The terrorist killed in Kulgam belonged to Hizbul Mujahideen terror outfit, the official added.

17.title: With 4 games remaining, we've chance to win series vs SA: Bhuvneshwar
17.article_body: Ahead of India-South Africa second T20I, India pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar said with four matches remaining, his side has a chance to win the five-match series. "We've to bowl better and we need to bat in the same fashion as the previous game," he added. Match will be played in Cuttack on Sunday. India trail South Africa 0-1 in ongoing series.

18.title: Home Minister Shah seeks early probe of rape, sexual assault cases
18.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday sought an early investigation of rape and sexual assault cases against women and children, according to an official. Shah also sought stringent punishment against the offenders in a time-bound manner, the official said. Shah made the comments at the 25th meeting of the Western Zonal Council in Diu.

19.title: 3 killed, 1 injured after being hit by train in UP's Prayagraj
19.article_body: Three persons were killed and another person was injured after being hit by a train at Shankargarh railway station in Prayagraj, an official said. Some passengers got down on the other side of the platform and while returning, they were hit by the Chambal Express, the official said. It is yet to be known why they got off the train.

20.title: Bride's sister killed, 10 injured in firing at UP wedding function
20.article_body: The 35-year-old sister of a bride was killed and 10 persons were injured when gunshots were fired during a quarrel at a wedding function in Uttar Pradesh's Etah on Saturday. "An argument broke out between the family members of the bride and some villagers over applying colours," SP Etah said. He added that some suspects have been detained for questioning.

21.title: He might play at Wimbledon: Toni after nephew Nadal's foot treatment
21.article_body: Rafael Nadal's uncle Toni Nadal revealed that his nephew has been feeling "much better" after the foot treatment and wants to train. "And if he has a little chance, he'll play at Wimbledon. He goes on the court on Monday," he added. Days after his record-extending 14th French Open win, Nadal began treatment for his chronic foot problem in Barcelona.

22.title: Hate and unrest not our way, says Rahul Gandhi
22.article_body: A day after the outbreak of violence during protests over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet Muhammad, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday tweeted, "Hate and unrest isn't our way." "Our country has always set an example of truth, non-violence and brotherhood before the world," he said. "It's the responsibility of all...people...to unite India and maintain mutual goodwill," he added.

23.title: It could be society ending: Bill Gates on another virus with 5% fatality rate
23.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said the emergence of another virus with similar virulence to COVID-19 but with 5% fatality rate could be "society ending". He said the world got "lucky" that the death rate per COVID-19 case was 0.2%. "Given the toll of this pandemic...20 million dead globally, a million in the US...it could've been way more fatal," Gates claimed.

24.title: Indian crypto investors got lucky due to tax announcement in Feb: Zerodha CEO
24.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath on Saturday said many Indian cryptocurrency investors "accidentally got lucky" due to announcement of TDS and tax on crypto during the Budget in February. If not for the announcement, "many could've potentially been trapped trying to buy the dip and then averaging down", Kamath said. The government had announced 30% tax on income from digital assets.

25.title: Nayanthara-Vignesh Shivan get notice for violating Tirupati temple rules, apologise
25.article_body: Nayanthara and Vignesh Shivan, who visited Tirupati temple after their wedding, received notices for wearing footwear inside the temple and doing photoshoots. "In the commotion, we failed to notice we were walking with shoes...We apologise," the couple said. "We've been to Tirupati five times in...last month with the desire to get married...Due to various reasons, it wasn't possible," they added.

26.title: India will definitely bounce back in 2nd T20I: SA all-rounder Parnell
26.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Wayne Parnell said the side's second T20I against India in Cuttack will be crucial, adding the hosts will definitely bounce back. "They're a quality side; we don't expect anything less...every single game till Bengaluru is going to be tough," he added. South Africa are currently leading 1-0 in five-match series. Second T20I will be played on Sunday.

27.title: Development works not done to win elections, says PM Modi in Gujarat
27.article_body: During his visit to Gujarat on Friday, PM Narendra Modi said that his government's development projects are not undertaken to win elections but for the good of the people. It is the "people who make us win elections", he added. Notably, PM Modi laid foundation stones, inaugurated and dedicated projects worth ₹3,050 crore during his day-long visit to the state.

28.title: Team India trains in packed stadium in Cuttack, BCCI shares pics
28.article_body: The BCCI took to Twitter to share pictures from Team India's training at the Barabati Stadium in Cuttack ahead of the second T20I against South Africa. "Match day feels on a non-match day...A packed stadium here in Cuttack to watch Team India train," BCCI wrote. "This is why there should be more matches in small towns," a fan commented.

29.title: New Zealand record their highest 5th wicket partnership in Test cricket history
29.article_body: New Zealand recorded their highest partnership for fifth wicket in Test cricket history during their first innings against England in the second Test. Daryl Mitchell and Tom Blundell shared a 236-run stand to set the record. The previous record was held by Nathan Astle and Craig McMillan, who shared a 222-run stand against Zimbabwe in Wellington in 2000.

30.title: Mamata calls Opposition leaders' meeting ahead of Presidential poll
30.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has called for a meeting of Opposition leaders on June 15 in New Delhi ahead of the election for the next President of India on July 18. "At a time when our democracy is going through troubling times, I believe that a fruitful confluence of opposition voices is the need of the hour," she said.

31.title: I like both: Shaheen Afridi on choosing between Kohli and Babar
31.article_body: On being asked to pick either Virat Kohli or Babar Azam, Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi replied, "I like both, yeah!" Recently, Babar became the fastest batter to score 1,000 runs as skipper in the ODI format. He achieved this mark in 13 innings as Pakistan captain, breaking India captain Kohli's record, which he set in 17 innings.

32.title: China warns of new 'strongly explosive' COVID-19 outbreak in Beijing
32.article_body: Authorities in China's capital Beijing have warned of a new outbreak of COVID-19 cases related to a bar, saying that the outbreak is "strongly explosive in nature". The outbreak is "widespread in scope and composition of individuals involved is also complex", said a spokesman of the Beijing municipal government. Beijing has reported 115 cases linked to the bar outbreak.

33.title: We just got lucky the death rate per COVID-19 case was 0.2%: Bill Gates
33.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said the world got "lucky" that the death rate per COVID-19 case was 0.2%. "Given the toll of this pandemic...20 million dead globally, a million in the US...it could have been way more fatal," the billionaire claimed. He further said the emergence of another virus with similar virulence but 5% fatality rate could be "society ending".

34.title: Buildings of violence-accused bulldozed in UP after protests over Prophet remarks
34.article_body: Buildings of those accused of violence during recent protests over remarks on Prophet Muhammad were demolished in UP's Kanpur and Saharanpur on Saturday. In Kanpur, parts of a building owned by businessman Mohammad Ishtiyaq, a relative of 'key conspirator' Hayat Zafar Hashmi, were demolished. In Saharanpur, the houses of two of the accused, Muzammil and Abdul Waqir, were razed.

35.title: Candidates who submitted blank sheets hired as teachers in Bengal: CBI
35.article_body: A probe into irregularities during recruitment of primary school teachers in West Bengal has found that some candidates who submitted blank answer sheets have been hired to teach, a CBI official said on Saturday. The candidates had only written their names and registration numbers on the sheets, the official added. Several officials are involved in the irregularities, the official claimed.

36.title: Cong expels Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi for cross-voting in Rajya Sabha polls
36.article_body: The Congress on Saturday expelled Haryana MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi from all party positions, including the post of the special invitee to the Congress Working Committee, for cross-voting in the Rajya Sabha elections. Congress said while Bishnoi cross-voted, the vote of another MLA was declared invalid. CM Manohar Lal Khattar has claimed that Bishnoi voted after "listening to his inner conscience".

37.title: Celebrity fashion designer Prathyusha Garimella found dead at her home in Telangana
37.article_body: Celebrity fashion designer Prathyusha Garimella was found dead at her residence in Telangana, police said on Saturday. Police have seized a carbon monoxide cylinder from her bedroom and a case has been registered under the section of suspicious death, said ANI while quoting a circle inspector. Her body has been shifted to the Osmania Hospital for autopsy.

38.title: Hockey India congratulates Rani on completing 250 international caps
38.article_body: Hockey India has congratulated striker Rani Rampal on completing 250 international caps on Saturday. Rani, who has been on a long injury layoff after Tokyo Olympics, achieved this milestone during India's match against Belgium in FIH Women's Pro Hockey League in Antwerp, Belgium. "This is a very special moment for me...it is indeed a milestone to remember," said Rani.

39.title: ₹11.97-crore tax evasion detected at hotels near Gir National Park
39.article_body: The Gujarat Goods and Services Tax department conducted searches on hotels, resorts and booking agents operating in and around Sasan Gir National Park and found tax evasion worth ₹11.97 crore. According to an official statement, the hotels and resorts were found to have recorded lower room tariffs, provided unaccounted services and also paid tax under low slabs.

40.title: I'd love to be in BCCI administration if that comes my way: Mithali
40.article_body: Former India Women Test and ODI captain Mithali Raj said she'd love to be in BCCI administration if it comes her way, given the experience she has had in her 23-year-long career. "You can have a woman in a certain position because women understand women's cricket much better," she added. The 39-year-old represented India in 333 matches across all formats.

41.title: Mumbai reports 1,745 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death; active cases cross 10,000
41.article_body: Mumbai has reported 1,745 fresh COVID-19 cases, 888 recoveries and one death in the last 24 hours. The active cases in the city have crossed the 10,000-mark to stand at 10,047, reportedly after a gap of several months. Mumbai has reported a positivity rate of 12.26% and the overall growth rate of cases between June 4 and 10 was 0.122%.

42.title: China hardening its position along border with India: US Defence Secretary
42.article_body: China has continued to "harden its position along the border that it shares with India", US Defence Secretary Lloyd J Austin said on Saturday. America stands by its friends as they uphold their rights, Austin said, adding that Beijing is adopting a "war coercive", "aggressive approach" to its territorial claims. An American general recently called Chinese activities near Ladakh "alarming".

43.title: Apple's M1 chip has a hardware flaw that can't be patched, claim MIT researchers
43.article_body: Researchers at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) have claimed that they have discovered a new hardware vulnerability in Apple's M1 chip, which cannot be fixed by any software patch. The researchers said that they created a novel hardware attack, which is capable of exploiting the M1 chip's last line of security defence, pointer authentication code, without leaving a trace.

44.title: Kashmiri YouTuber arrested for posting video depicting beheading of Nupur Sharma
44.article_body: Kashmiri YouTuber Faisal Wani was on Saturday arrested and booked after his video depicting the beheading of ex-BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma surfaced online, J&K Police said. "He had uploaded an incriminating video on YouTube which is against public tranquillity and has caused fear and alarm to the public in general," said police. Wani had earlier apologised and deleted the video.

45.title: Kuldeep was one of my targets in IPL mega auction: DC head coach Ponting
45.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting has revealed spinner Kuldeep Yadav was one of his main targets heading into 2022 IPL mega auction. "Because I've seen how good he has been in the past. His skill hadn't gone anywhere," he added. Kuldeep, who was bought for ₹2 crore, was DC's highest wicket-taker in IPL 2022 with 21 wickets in 14 matches.

46.title: Internet services suspended in West Bengal's Beldanga, Murshidabad
46.article_body: The West Bengal government has temporarily suspended internet services in Beldanga and Murshidabad till 6 am on June 14 in a bid to stop rumours and prevent unlawful activities owing to protests over remarks against Prophet Muhammad. This comes a day after internet services were suspended in violence-hit Howrah till June 13 and Section 144 was imposed in several areas.

47.title: Gang helping migrants get Aadhaar illegally busted in Bengaluru
47.article_body: The Bengaluru Rural Police said that they've busted a nine-member gang for allegedly helping foreign migrants, especially from Bangladesh, get Aadhaar card and other citizenship-related documents illegally. The accused used to charge the migrants between ₹500 and ₹1,000 for the service. The police also said that they've seized 31 Aadhaar cards, 13 PAN cards and 28 voter ID cards.

48.title: Paytm begins charging some users extra fees for mobile recharges: Report
48.article_body: Paytm has reportedly begun charging some of its users a small fee for mobile recharges done via the financial platform. This charge can be anywhere between ₹1 and ₹6, depending on how large the recharge amount is. The fee is being levied on mobile recharges paid for via UPI or a bank credit/debit card.

49.title: 19-yr-old TikTok star Cooper Noriega found dead hours after post about dying young
49.article_body: Cooper Noriega, a 19-year-old TikTok star with over 1.7 million followers, died on Thursday. According to officials, Noriega was found dead in a Los Angeles mall parking lot. He had tweeted a video of himself lying in bed with the message, "Who else [be] thinking they [gonna] die young af?" just hours before his death, reported Variety.

50.title: 35 stalls sealed during anti-encroachment drive in Pune
50.article_body: At least 35 stalls were sealed during an anti-encroachment drive carried out by the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Friday. "This drive has come about because of complaints and demands from people for new licenses," said PMC's Anti-encroachment Department Head. He added that about 60% of the license holders had rented out their stalls, making running these stalls illegal.

51.title: 20-year-old man stabs 18-yr-old to death in Mumbai, arrested
51.article_body: Police said that they have arrested a 20-year-old man for allegedly stabbing an 18-year-old girl to death at her residence in Mumbai's Govandi area. Police said that the incident took place when the victim, Fauziya Khan, was alone at home. "We have detained the accused and are questioning him to find out the reason for the attack," police added.

52.title: GHMC Mayor inspects Strategic Nala Development Programme in Hyd
52.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal conducted a surprise inspection of the Strategic Nala Development Programme (SNDP) works on Friday. She directed the officials to speed up the work while taking the required precautionary measures. "Sixty works have been undertaken at a cost of ₹985 crore," Gadwal had said earlier.

53.title: Copper wire worth ₹10 lakh stolen from Police Command Centre in Hyd
53.article_body: Copper bundles worth ₹10 lakh were stolen from an under-construction Police Command Centre in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills. Police said that it was an 'inside job' and that a construction worker was stealing copper wire bundles to resell them at a higher value. The Command and Control Centre is being constructed at Banjara Hills at an estimated cost of ₹600 crore.

54.title: 45-year-old man electrocuted while pruning trees in Navi Mumbai
54.article_body: A 45-year-old worker, Gautam Yadav, died after being hit by a high voltage power line while pruning trees in Navi Mumbai's Vashi. "The society had sought permission from us to get branches trimmed before the monsoon begins," said Vashi ward officer. The permission letter mentioned it is their responsibility to look after property and life during the process, he added.

55.title: Pune civic body gets 30 fogging machines for cleaning activities
55.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has received 30 fogging machines for cleaning activities in the 23 newly merged areas. PMC Additional Municipal Commissioner Ravindra Binwade said that the machines have been procured with the help of CSR fund. A PMC official added that the authorities aim to carry out timely spraying and fogging during monsoon to prevent waterborne diseases.

56.title: 227 arrested in UP so far over protests against remarks on Prophet
56.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has arrested 227 people so far in connection with violence during protests that broke out across the state against remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. "Strictest action will be taken against anti-social elements involved in the chaotic efforts to spoil the atmosphere in various cities in the past few days," CM Yogi Adityanath told officials.

57.title: Mithali calls me 'Prime Minister' because I talk a lot: Yastika
57.article_body: Speaking about ex-teammate Mithali Raj, who recently announced her retirement from all forms of international cricket, India Women batter Yastika Bhatia stated, "Mithali Di calls me 'Prime Minister' because I talk a lot in team meetings and give my opinions." She added, "We've a great bond. In my debut, Mithali Di was the captain and she guided me very well."

58.title: GB Nagar policeman dismissed for skipping work for nearly 200 days
58.article_body: A constable of Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has been dismissed for violating Uttar Pradesh government service rules after he remained absent from work without permission for nearly 200 days, officials said. Chitrasen Kumar got married for the second time without separating from his first wife during the same period, they added. Kumar has been booked for the second marriage.

59.title: BJP MP loses 15 kg after Gadkari promises ₹1,000cr in development funds for each kg lost
59.article_body: Ujjain BJP MP Anil Firojiya claimed he lost 15 kg since February 2022, when Union Minister Nitin Gadkari had promised to clear ₹1,000 crore for the development of Ujjain for every kg that Firojiya lost. "I am the most expensive MP in the world," said the 50-year-old MP, who weighed 127 kg when Gadkari made the promise at an event.

60.title: 1 dead, 6 injured after part of building collapses in Navi Mumbai
60.article_body: One person died and at least six others sustained injuries after part of a building collapsed in Navi Mumbai's Nerul on Saturday. As per reports, the ceiling slab of a sixth-floor flat collapsed while some drilling work of the flooring was underway. Several other residents are reportedly feared trapped under debris. An operation to rescue the trapped persons is underway.

61.title: It's something special: Swiatek on breaking Serena's 34 wins in a row record
61.article_body: Talking about breaking Serena Williams' unbeaten run of 34 matches, set in 2013, world number one Iga Swiatek said "it's something special". She added, "I always wanted to have some kind of a record. In tennis, it's pretty hard after Serena's career." The 21-year-old Pole claimed her second French Open title by winning her 35th consecutive match on Sunday.

62.title: Threatened by CM's envoy: Prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling
62.article_body: Swapna Suresh, prime accused in Kerala gold smuggling case, has released an audio clip, where a man was allegedly heard threatening her to withdraw her statement claiming CM Pinarayi Vijayan and his family's involvement in the case. Suresh claimed the man, Shaj Kiran, is an envoy of CM to limit further damage. Kiran said that the audio seems "heavily edited".

63.title: I was a college dropout, had to prove myself: Unicorn startup PhysicsWallah's CEO
63.article_body: Alakh Pandey, the Founder and CEO of edtech startup PhysicsWallah which achieved unicorn status this week, told YourStory, "I was a college dropout and I had to prove myself." Pandey started PhysicsWallah as a YouTube channel in 2016 with an investment of about ₹30,000. The startup has raised $100 million in its Series A funding at a $1.1 billion valuation.

64.title: Bengal BJP chief put under house arrest for trying to visit riot-hit Howrah
64.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Saturday claimed he was placed under house arrest by police, on CM Mamata Banerjee's instruction. "Bengal needs strong action against people...disturbing peace in the state and not house arrest of BJP leaders," he tweeted. The incident reportedly took place when Majumdar was trying to visit violence-hit Howrah, where Section 144 is currently imposed.

65.title: Very happy that all our 3 candidates won: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis
65.article_body: BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis on Saturday expressed happiness after BJP won three out of six Rajya Sabha seats in Maharashtra. "Very happy that all our three candidates- Piyush Goyal, Anil Bonde, and Dhananjay Mahadik have been elected to Rajya Sabha," he said. "Mahadik ne aisa dhobi pachhad lagaya...that he got more votes than Sanjay Raut," he added.

66.title: Pant is an outstanding young man, got the world at his feet: Ponting
66.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Ricky Ponting said Rishabh Pant is an "outstanding" young man who has got the world "at his feet". "He'll be exceptionally dangerous for India, especially on the wickets we’ll prepare in Australia (for the T20 World Cup) – good, fast, flat, bouncy wickets," added Ponting. Ponting is the head coach of IPL franchise DC. Pant is DC's captain.

67.title: Yuvraj has been married to golf since retirement, jokes his mom Shabnam
67.article_body: Yuvraj Singh's mother Shabnam Singh jokingly said he has been married to golf since retirement, adding it's been two months since she saw Yuvraj. Yuvraj announced his retirement from international cricket on June 10, 2019. "I love the sport but...also hate it...I hate it because it has been very tough on me mentally," he had said in his retirement video.

68.title: Ghaziabad civic body plans to start door-to-door e-waste collection
68.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation (GMC) has announced that it plans to start door-to-door e-waste collection from households from next month. The move is expected to generate an estimated 500 tonnes of e-waste every month, according to a report. Currently, households in the city depend primarily on scrap dealers to sell their e-waste, the report said.

69.title: Murray beats top seed Tsitsipas to reach Boss Open semis in Stuttgart
69.article_body: Unseeded Andy Murray defeated top seed Stefanos Tsitsipas 7-6(7-4), 6-3 to advance to the Boss Open semi-final in Stuttgart on Friday. It was the former world number one's first victory over a top-five player since 2016. Murray is now 1-1 in head-to-head against Tsitsipas and has improved to 113-23 on grass. He'll now face Australia's Nick Kyrgios.

70.title: Wanted to do something Spielberg, James Cameron did in Hollywood: Ayan Mukerji
70.article_body: Filmmaker Ayan Mukerji, while talking about his upcoming film 'Brahmāstra', said he wanted to be that young director who is trying to do something that Steven Spielberg or James Cameron did in Hollywood. He said that he wanted to create the same impact with an Indian story. "I didn't want to do it with stories that were western," Mukerji added.

71.title: Doctors said I had 2 weeks to live: Director Anurag Basu on battling blood cancer
71.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Basu, speaking about his battle with blood cancer in 2004, revealed that doctors said he had two weeks left to live. "My condition started deteriorating rapidly...My platelets were decreasing," he said in an episode of Unfiltered By Samdish. "The day I got scared was when my mom and dad stopped facing me in the hospital," Anurag stated.

72.title: Rainfall predicted in several states over next 5 days, IMD releases list
72.article_body: IMD predicted rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, sub-Himalayan Sikkim and parts of West Bengal during the next five days. Bihar, Jharkhand, Odisha, MP, Vidarbha (Maharashtra) and Chhattisgarh will also likely see isolated/scattered rain. IMD also forecast rain in Karnataka, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Tamil Nadu, Lakshadweep and Puducherry.

73.title: Sara Ali Khan to star opposite Ayushmann in 'Dream Girl 2': Report
73.article_body: Sara Ali Khan will reportedly star opposite Ayushmann Khurrana in the sequel of 'Dream Girl'. "They (makers) think Sara fits the bill, and have begun talks with her," Mid-day quoted a source as saying. The film will go on floors later in the year, reports added. Notably, the first part released in 2019 with Nushrratt Bharuccha as the female lead.

74.title: Playing first-division matches a part of workload management: Ashwin
74.article_body: Having played first-division matches recently, India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin said he considers playing such matches as a part of workload management, adding playing such games enabled him to shift from T20 cricket to red-ball cricket. "As you grow older, you...play smarter," added Ashwin. "I can contribute with the bat and bowl well. I want to...keep working," stated Ashwin.

75.title: Australia-France reach $583 mn settlement over scrapped submarine deal
75.article_body: The Australian government has reached a €555 million ($583.58 million) settlement with France over a scrapped submarine deal. Australia last year had scrapped a $40 billion submarine contract with French military shipyard Naval Group in favour of a deal with the US and UK to build nuclear-powered submarines. The move had created a rift between the two countries.

76.title: Kids made me get a heart check-up after KK's death: Shaan
76.article_body: Singer Shaan has revealed that he received many messages from people asking him to take care of his health after KK died on May 31, shortly after performing at a concert in Kolkata. "My children were also insisting, so I especially went to Mumbai...and had heart check-up," he added. Shaan also urged people to take out time for routine check-ups.

77.title: Felt like I was watching real Sandy: Major Sandeep's colleague on 'Major'
77.article_body: Razzaque Adil, colleague of Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan, has penned a note praising Adivi Sesh's latest film 'Major', which is based on the life of Unnikrishnan. "Adivi looks the part and gets Sandy's mannerisms right...In some scenes, I felt like I was watching...real Sandy on screen," he wrote, adding that 'Major' is a "well-made movie which gets most of the facts...right".

78.title: Twitter Co-founder Dorsey's TBD to build Bitcoin-based 'Web5'
78.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey-owned Block's subsidiary TBD will be building a new Bitcoin-focussed decentralised web platform called 'Web5'. "Web5 brings decentralised identity and data storage to individual's applications," TBD explained. TBD lead Mike Brock said that Web5 would beat out incumbent models by abandoning their blockchain-centric approaches to an identity-focussed web experience.

79.title: 72-yr-old arrested for extorting over ₹3 lakh from builder in Thane
79.article_body: Police arrested a 72-year-old man for allegedly extorting over ₹3 lakh from a builder in Maharashtra's Thane. The accused, who claimed to be an activist, allegedly made applications stating that redevelopment work at a housing society under the builder was illegal and demanded ₹5 lakh from him to withdraw the applications. Police caught him accepting ₹3.11 lakh on Thursday.

80.title: Google employee calculates value of pi to 100 tn digits in a new world record
80.article_body: Google Cloud employee Emma Haruka Iwao has calculated the value of pi to its 100-trillionth digit, which is zero, in a new world record. Three years ago, Iwao had calculated 31.4 trillion digits of pi, setting a world record at the time. This record was broken by Swiss scientists last year, when they calculated another 31.4 trillion digits of pi.

81.title: 6 Indian banks sue GVK Coal Developers for over ₹11,700cr for loan default: Report
81.article_body: Six Indian banks, namely Canara Bank, ICICI Bank, Bank of Baroda, Bank of India, Axis Bank and Indian Overseas Bank, have reportedly sued GVK Coal Developers (Singapore), for over ₹11,700 crore ($1.5 billion), in London High Court. The dispute is over a $1-billion loan default, a $35-million letter of credit facility lent in 2011 and a $160-million loan from 2014.

82.title: MP man stabs wife for repeatedly telling him to go to work, kills self
82.article_body: A 30-year-old man allegedly stabbed his wife to death as she would repeatedly tell him to go to work before killing himself in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. According to police, the deceased was a driver and hadn't been working for 15 days. Upset with this, his wife kept nagging him about it. He reportedly stabbed her with scissors following an argument.

83.title: 287 children killed in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion
83.article_body: The office of Ukraine's Prosecutor General on Saturday said that at least 287 children have been killed and 492 others have been injured since February 24, when Russia began invading the country. "These figures are not final, as work is underway to establish them in places of active hostilities, in the temporarily occupied and liberated territories," the office said.

84.title: Pro-Khalistan slogans seen on wall of Judge's home in Punjab, probe on
84.article_body: Pro-Khalistan slogans were spotted on the wall of the residence of a Sessions Court Judge in Punjab's Faridkot on Saturday. Faridkot SSP said a video of Sikhs for Justice activist Gurpatwant Singh Pannu, who was earlier booked after Khalistani flags were found at Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly, has come to light. Investigation in the matter is underway, the SSP added.

85.title: PMC to extend contracts of health staff hired on temporary basis
85.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has announced that it'll extend the contracts of 118 health professionals who were hired to help curb the spread of COVID-19. The civic body has decided to discontinue the service of 10 laboratory technicians. Notably, the extension of the health staff will be for a minimum of 44 days and a maximum of three months.

86.title: US gasoline average price crosses $5 per gallon for the 1st time in history
86.article_body: With inflation hitting a 40-year high in the US in May at 8.6%, the average price of a gallon of regular gas crossed $5 for the first time in the country on Saturday. There are now 20 US states including Washington, DC, with averages of $5 or above. The highest-priced state remains California, with an average of $6.42 a gallon.

87.title: Shutting liquor shops for Sitharaman's Goa visit is laughable: Goa MLA
87.article_body: Goa MLA Vijai Sardesai on Saturday said that "the absurdity of shutting liquor shops by the state government because of Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman's visit is laughable." He also shared a picture of an official order on the same, however, the state government clarified that only a wine shop and two bars in Panaji were told to stay shut.

88.title: Bad luck: Mary after injuring her knee in boxing trials for 2022 CWG
88.article_body: After Mary Kom withdrew from women's boxing trials for 2022 Commonwealth Games due to a knee injury on Friday, the six-time world champion said, "I was training so hard for this. This is just bad luck." Mary suffered the injury in 48kg semi-finals against Haryana's Nitu. In 2018, Mary became the first Indian woman to win boxing gold at CWG.

89.title: Bookie dies by suicide over debts due to cricket betting in Gurugram
89.article_body: A 33-year-old man, who was a bookie and a real estate broker, allegedly died by suicide inside his house in Gurugram on Thursday, police said. The man shot himself in the head over debts he had incurred due to cricket betting, police added. "According to his neighbours, some financers visited his house on Thursday and created a ruckus," police stated.

90.title: 'Comedian' lowly term for an artist, has become an abuse: Shekhar Suman
90.article_body: Actor and host Shekhar Suman said he doesn't believe comedians get their fair due in the industry. "'Comedian' is a very lowly term for an artist," Shekhar said, adding, that they won't be able to get their due unless people address them as entertainers or artists. "Over a period of time, the term 'comedian' has become an abuse," he added.

91.title: EU chief arrives in Ukraine's capital Kyiv for talks with Zelenskyy
91.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen arrived in Ukraine's capital Kyiv on Saturday for a meeting with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Von der Leyen said she and Zelenskyy would discuss the country's reconstruction and the progress made by Ukraine towards European Union membership. This is the EU chief's second trip to Ukraine since Russia began invading the country in February.

92.title: Glad they're ok: Musk as Tesla driver survives car crashing into a forest in US
92.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk responded after a Twitter user shared how a Tesla driver survived their car crashing into a forest in the US and escaped with minor injuries. The driver reportedly suffered a medical emergency, causing them to unwillingly accelerate. The Tesla car ran into a tree, which sent it flying through the forest. "Glad they're ok," Musk said.

93.title: Nagarjuna's first look from Ranbir and Alia-starrer 'Brahmastra' out
93.article_body: Director Ayan Mukerji took to Instagram to share a motion poster revealing Nagarjuna Akkineni's look for the upcoming movie 'Brahmastra'. Calling him "a gentleman with the warmest of hearts", Ayan wrote, "He...gave his fierce intensity to our movie...and greatly added to our dream - of creating a truly pan-India movie experience." The film also stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

94.title: Acting is 'funny' job, one has to make peace with ups & downs: Aditya
94.article_body: Aditya Roy Kapur said being an actor is a "funny" and "unpredictable" job. One should be able to make peace with the ups and downs, he added. "Early...in your career, you aren't so well equipped to handle it. But as...years go on, you realise...it's all transient," Aditya stated, adding that keeping one's self-confidence intact is the most important thing.

95.title: Tajikistan's Rozik sings 'Papa Kehte...' at Rahman's daughter's reception
95.article_body: Tajikistan-born Abdu Rozik, the world's smallest singer, took to his Instagram handle to share a video of him singing the song, 'Papa Kehte Hain Bada Naam Karega' at the wedding reception of AR Rahman's daughter Khatija Rahman. In the video, Rozik could be seen singing on stage with AR Rahman watching him from close proximity. "Godfather," Rozik captioned the video.

96.title: Roof of Stuart Broad's pub collapses after bursting into flames in UK, pics surface
96.article_body: A major fire broke out at England cricketer Stuart Broad-owned 'Tap & Run' pub in Upper Broughton village in UK's Nottinghamshire. The fire occurred on the first floor and the roof of the pub. The roof collapsed after bursting into flames. As many as eight fire engines were called to the site.

97.title: BJP suspends Raj MLA Shobha Rani for cross-voting in RS polls
97.article_body: The BJP has suspended its Rajasthan MLA Shobha Rani Kushwaha for allegedly cross-voting in favour of Congress candidate Pramod Tiwari in Rajya Sabha elections. In a notice, the BJP's disciplinary committee has asked her to respond within seven days, explaining why she should not be expelled from the party. Congress won three seats in the elections, while BJP won one.

98.title: Tesla glass roof remains intact after massive tree falls on it, driver escapes unhurt
98.article_body: The driver of a Tesla reportedly managed to walk away unharmed after a massive tree fell on the glass roof of his car. The incident was reported from China and visuals of the white Tesla Model 3 pinned down by the tree have gone viral on social media. Its glass roof didn't shatter even when the tree fell on it.

99.title: I still feel India could have played Deepak Hooda: Gambhir on 1st T20I
99.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said he still feels India could have played all-rounder Deepak Hooda in the first T20I against South Africa, which they lost by seven wickets. Gambhir termed Hooda's form and him being a youngster as the reason behind his statement. Hooda scored 451 runs recently in IPL 2022 for LSG and had a strike rate of 136.66.

100.title: I broke a few things in the dressing room: Akhtar on 2011 WC semi-final against India
100.article_body: Ex-Pakistan fast bowler Shoaib Akhtar has said that he broke a few things in the dressing room after Pakistan lost the 2011 World Cup semi-final against India in Mohali. "Mohali memory haunts me...They should have played me, they should have. It was completely unfair from the team management," said Akhtar, who had missed the match due to an injury.

101.title: UP CM's advisor posts bulldozer pic after violence, says 'Every Friday followed by Saturday'
101.article_body: A day after violence and protests erupted in several states over remarks on Prophet Muhammad by ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma, UP CM Yogi Adityanath's media advisor Mrityunjay Kumar shared a picture of a bulldozer. "Rioters must remember, every Friday is followed by a Saturday," he wrote. The protests broke out after Friday prayers.

102.title: UN adopts resolution on multilingualism that mentions Hindi for the 1st time
102.article_body: The United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) has adopted an India-sponsored resolution on multilingualism that mentions the Hindi language for the first time. The resolution encourages the UN to continue disseminating important communications and messages in official as well as in non-official languages, including in Hindi language. The resolution also mentions Bangla and Urdu for the first time.

103.title: US to lift COVID testing requirement for international air travellers
103.article_body: From June 12, the US will no longer require international air travellers to have proof of a negative COVID-19 test before entering the country. The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) will re-evaluate the decision in 90 days and the testing requirement could be reinstated if a troubling new variant emerges, a US government official said.

104.title: BJP's sin, why should people suffer: Mamata Banerjee on violence in Howrah
104.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee blamed BJP for violence in Howrah over comments made on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP spokesperson and said, "[It's] BJP's sin, why should people suffer?" "There are some political parties behind what is happening in Howrah. They want to cause riots but this will not be tolerated. Strict action will be taken," she tweeted.

105.title: South Africa series is a good opportunity to express myself: Hardik Pandya
105.article_body: India all-rounder Hardik Pandya has said that the ongoing T20I series against South Africa is a "good opportunity to express" himself. "My roles will change here. I won't be the captain and I won't be batting higher up the order. This will be back to what I've been known for," Pandya said.

106.title: Time for Tom Latham to take over captaincy of NZ Test side: Simon Doull
106.article_body: Former New Zealand pacer Simon Doull has said that it's almost time for Kiwi batter Tom Latham to "take over the Test side". "He's (Latham) a terrific captain. I think he reads the game really well...If Kane Williamson is fit for the last Test and captains New Zealand, might it be for the last time in Test cricket?" Doull asked.

107.title: Pune district reported 5 malaria cases until May 31 this year: Data
107.article_body: Pune district has reported five cases of malaria until May 31 this year, according to official data. Speaking about efforts to curb the spread of malaria, Zilla Parishad CEO Ayush Prasad said, "We hope to keep up the outcome through prevention, early detection and proper treatment." Notably, no lives were lost to the disease this year.

108.title: Pak won't get such pitches in Australia: Inzamam on pitches for WI series
108.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said Pakistan won't get pitches similar to the ones seen in the ongoing home series against West Indies, when they will go to Australia for the T20 World Cup 2022. Ex-Pakistan captain Salman Butt had earlier stated that pitches prepared by Pakistan at home take everything away from a captain in terms of "strategy".

109.title: Muhammad Nawaz was outstanding with the ball: Babar Azam
109.article_body: After Pakistan registered a victory by 120 runs against the West Indies on Friday, skipper Babar Azam praised spinner Muhammad Nawaz for his four-wicket haul. "Nawaz was outstanding, he picked wickets at crucial moments. We were under pressure after the first 10 overs but really happy with the way we fought back," Azam said.

110.title: BJP's victory in Rajya Sabha polls through 'horse-trading': Sanjay Raut
110.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday claimed that the Bharatiya Janata Party secured Rajya Sabha seats in the recent elections in Maharashtra through horse-trading. "The victory [of BJP] was not a mandate," he said. Raut also said that the poll results don't pose any threat to the ruling coalition government of Maharashtra Vikas Aghadi (MVA).

111.title: Rishi & I'd broken up during 'Parda...' shoot, we used to fight a lot: Neetu
111.article_body: Neetu Kapoor recently revealed that she had broken up with Rishi Kapoor during the shoot of their song 'Parda Hai Parda'. "Rishi Ji and I were at loggerheads at the time of...song's shoot. We used to fight a lot," she said, adding, "It was...romantic song where I'd to throw a rose...but what was going in my mind was something else."

112.title: Shreyas has to improve his game against fast bowlers: Jaffer
112.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said India batter Shreyas Iyer needs to improve his game against the fast bowlers. "He's batting in the top four, he isn't somebody who comes at the backend...that innings [against South Africa] could've been a little bit better," he added. Batting at number three, Shreyas scored a 27-ball 36 in first T20I against South Africa.

113.title: K'taka govt issues ordinance to reserve 1/3rd BBMP seats for OBCs
113.article_body: The Karnataka government has issued an ordinance for reserving one-third of the seats of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) council for Other Backward Classes (OBCs). The civic polls, which are pending since 2020, were delayed amid the ward delimitation process by the state government. The total reservation for OBCs and ST/SCs will remain under 50%, the ordinance states.

114.title: Chhattisgarh boy falls into 80-ft borewell, rescue op underway
114.article_body: An 11-year-old boy fell into an 80-foot-deep abandoned borewell at a village in Chhattisgarh's Janjgir-Champa district on Friday, an official said. National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) and State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) teams have been deployed to carry out the rescue operation. JCB excavators are reportedly being used to dig a parallel pit to rescue the child.

115.title: Russia using anti-ship missiles on land targets in Ukraine: UK
115.article_body: Russia is running short of more precise modern missiles and is using 1960s-era Kh-22 anti-ship missiles meant to destroy aircraft carriers with nuclear warheads against land targets in Ukraine, the UK Defence Ministry said. These 5.5-tonne Kh-22 missiles, when used in ground attacks with conventional warheads, are highly inaccurate and can cause severe collateral damage and casualties, it added.

116.title: Had OTT existed earlier, I wouldn't have to wait for 47 years: Pankaj
116.article_body: Pankaj Tripathi, while speaking about the significance of OTT, said he would have grown very early in his career had OTT existed at that time. "Wouldn't have had to wait for 47 years," Pankaj said. He further stated that with OTT, even side actors get recognition as there is enough time. "The struggle for actors has definitely reduced," Pankaj added.

117.title: How did Congress leader Ajay Maken lose in Haryana Rajya Sabha polls?
117.article_body: Eighty-eight votes were cast in Haryana Rajya Sabha polls. BJP's Krishan Panwar received 36, Congress' Ajay Maken got 29 and Independent candidate Kartikeya Sharma got 23. A candidate needed 29.34 votes to win. After Panwar won in first round, his excess votes 6.66 (36-29.34) were transferred to BJP-backed Sharma. Sharma's tally increased to 29.66, while Maken remained at 29.

118.title: Woman can't be forced to go outside & work just because she's a graduate: Bombay HC
118.article_body: A woman cannot be compelled to go to work merely because she's a graduate, the Bombay HC has said. "Our society hasn't yet accepted the woman...should contribute (towards household finances)," said Justice Bharati Dangre, adding that "it's a woman's choice to work" or "sit at home". HC was hearing a man's plea against paying maintenance to his estranged wife.

119.title: Putin carries poop case when he travels outside Moscow to hide health problems: Report
119.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin carries a suitcase filled with his own excrement and urine when he travels outside Moscow, as per reports. "Putin fears possibility of...information about his health getting into...hands of foreign intelligence services," a former DIA intelligence officer told Fox News. A report said Putin has a special aide from Federal Guard Service who handles the suitcase.

120.title: Sanjay, Mahesh & I did 'Kurukshetra' & strangely all of us got cancer: Mahima
120.article_body: Mahima Chaudhry, speaking about her battle with cancer, said, "Sanjay Dutt, Mahesh Manjrekar and I...did [film] 'Kurukshetra', and strangely, all of us had to battle cancer around...same time." While Sanjay was diagnosed with lung cancer, Mahesh was diagnosed with urinary bladder cancer. Mahima said stories of celebrities like Sanjay Dutt and Sonali Bendre inspired her during her cancer treatment.

121.title: Nadal winning French Open with a dead foot is outrageous: Ex-world no. 1
121.article_body: Ex-world number one doubles player Rennae Stubbs said watching Rafael Nadal win the French Open 2022 with a dead foot is "just outrageous". "I knew that he would be hitting that foot out with as much painkiller and anaesthetic that he could, to be able to operate on the tennis court and run," added Stubbs. "It's just unbelievable," stated Stubbs.

122.title: Indian women's boxing squad for CWG 2022 announced as Mary Kom ruled out due to injury
122.article_body: The Boxing Federation of India announced the Indian women's boxing squad for CWG 2022 following trials in Delhi. Nitu will represent India in 48-kg category, while Nikhat Zareen will feature in 50-kg category. Jaismine (60 kg) and Olympic bronze medallist Lovlina Borgohain (70 kg) have also been included. Notably, Mary Kom was ruled out of CWG 2022 due to injury.

123.title: Oil tanker falls off bridge, explodes in Odisha; 4 charred to death
123.article_body: At least four people were charred to death and one suffered serious injuries after an oil tanker fell off a bridge into a river and exploded in Odisha's Nayagarh, police said on Saturday. The oil tanker had hit the bridge's crash barrier after the driver lost control. Two of the deceased were people who'd gone to rescue driver and helper.

124.title: Prayagraj violence mastermind detained, police say 'kids were used to hurl stones'
124.article_body: The mastermind behind Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj violence on Friday, identified as Javed Ahmed, has been detained, Prayagraj SSP said. "There could be more masterminds...The anti-social elements used minor kids to hurl stones at police and administration," he added. Protests broke out in Prayagraj over former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad.

125.title: I couldn't become an actor so became one via teaching: PhysicsWallah's Founder
125.article_body: Edtech startup PhysicsWallah recently became India's 101st unicorn. Founder Alakh Pandey, a Prayagraj-based teacher who started PhysicsWallah as a YouTube channel in 2016 with an investment of about ₹30,000, said, "I couldn't become an actor, so I became an actor through teaching...I can showcase my whole acting talent through teaching. So I get that enjoyment as well."

126.title: Quit and find a firm you believe in: Coinbase CEO as staff seeks to remove execs
126.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong tweeted, "Quit and find a company to work at that you believe in," after an employee petition sought the removal of three top executives at the crypto exchange. He said that posting the petition in public was "deeply unethical". Armstrong further said, "It's also dumb because if you get caught you will be fired."

127.title: Fire breaks out at thermocol factory in Rajasthan's Dausa
127.article_body: A fire broke out at a polystyrene (thermocol) factory located in the Mahuwa area of Rajasthan's Dausa district on Saturday. According to reports, around 5-6 labourers are still trapped inside the factory and 25 fire brigades are being used for the rescue operation. "The fire broke out in the morning, and efforts are underway to douse the flames," police said.

128.title: FIR filed after protests outside Delhi's Jama Masjid over remarks on Prophet
128.article_body: Delhi Police filed FIR under section 188 of IPC after protests outside Jama Masjid against alleged inflammatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. "Around 1,500 people had gathered at the mosque for Friday prayers. When the prayers ended peacefully, some people came outside, started showing placards...others also joined them...numbers went up to around 300," police said.

129.title: China is becoming more coercive & aggressive: US Defence Secretary
129.article_body: US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin said America will do its part to manage tensions with China "responsibly" and prevent conflict even though Beijing is becoming more "aggressive" and "coercive" in the Asian region, including near Taiwan. He also said there's an "alarming" increase in the number of unsafe, unprofessional encounters between Chinese planes and vessels with those of other nations.

130.title: Inflation in US hits 8.6% in May, highest in 40 years
130.article_body: Amid rising prices of gas, food and other goods, inflation in the US hit a 40-year high of 8.6% in May. On a month-to-month basis, prices jumped 1% from April to May, faster than the 0.3% increase from March to April. Food prices were up more than 10% last month compared to May 2021, while energy surged more than 34%.

131.title: Visit Moosewala's parents 2-4 times a yr: Gippy Grewal urges artists
131.article_body: Singer Gippy Grewal, on the birth anniversary of late singer Sidhu Moosewala, penned a post for fellow artists of the Punjabi music industry. While sharing pictures with Moosewala, Grewal urged artists to visit his parents at least two to four times a year. "We should become like their son...and offer them love," Grewal said while urging artists to stay united.

132.title: Monsoon has arrived over Mumbai: IMD
132.article_body: The IMD on Saturday declared the arrival of southwest monsoon over Mumbai. "Conditions are favourable for further advance of monsoon into some parts of north Arabian sea, remaining parts of Konkan, some parts of Gujarat state, most parts of Madhya Maharashtra, entire Karnataka and Tamil Nadu, some parts of Telangana, Andhra Pradesh...during next 48 hours," IMD said.

133.title: Prez Kovind to inaugurate an ISKCON temple in Bengaluru on June 14
133.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind will inaugurate the Rajadhiraja Sri Govinda Temple of ISKCON in Bengaluru on June 14. The state's Governor, Chief Minister and other dignitaries will also participate in the event. The temple, which is a replica of the Sri Venkateshwara Temple in Tirumala, will have facilities for the spiritual and cultural education of children and families.

134.title: Man kills wife after quarrel over his liquor consumption in Pune
134.article_body: A 32-year-old engineer was arrested after he allegedly thrashed his 30-year-old wife to death following a quarrel over his liquor consumption in Pune, the police said. The incident took place on June 9 around 10.30 pm, while the couple's three-year-old daughter was at home, a sub-inspector said. An FIR was filed in the matter by the deceased's father on Friday.

135.title: IED recovered on Srinagar-Baramulla highway, traffic suspended
135.article_body: Traffic was suspended on the Srinagar-Baramulla highway in Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday after the security forces recovered an improvised explosive device (IED) near the highway. "The IED was recovered in Putkha area of Sangrama in Baramulla district by five Rashtriya Rifles and the J&K Police," police said. "Efforts are on to defuse the IED," they added.

136.title: Very concerning: Canada after China harasses its patrol aircraft near North Korea
136.article_body: Canada has said China showed "very concerning and unprofessional" behaviour while harassing its patrol aircraft near North Korea. Canadian military had said China forced its planes to divert from flight paths as they monitored North Korea sanction evasions. Meanwhile, China said Canada stepped up provocations against the country under the pretext of implementing UN Security Council resolutions.

137.title: Don't want it to be crap: Hamilton on not appearing in Pitt's film on F1
137.article_body: Seven-time Formula 1 world champion Lewis Hamilton said he will not appear in an upcoming untitled film on F1 starring Brad Pitt which Hamilton will be co-producing, as he doesn't want the movie to be "crap". "My responsibility...is...making sure...the cast and the crew...is diverse," added Hamilton. "We are...spending good time with Brad which is pretty epic," stated Hamilton.

138.title: Jharkhand CM appeals for peace amid violence in state over Prophet row
138.article_body: Amid the ongoing violence over the Prophet row in Jharkhand's Ranchi where two people have been killed, CM Hemant Soren has appealed to the public to maintain peace. "I suddenly received information about this worrisome (protest) incident...public of Jharkhand has always been very sensitive and tolerant...no need to panic. I appeal to everyone to maintain harmony," CM Soren said.

139.title: Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak joins Salman in 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
139.article_body: Actress Shweta Tiwari's daughter Palak Tiwari has joined the cast of Salman Khan's upcoming movie 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. "Palak has been handpicked by Salman himself. She will be seen opposite Jassie (Gill) and has an amazing track in the film. She has joined the shoot," reports stated. The film, directed by Farhad Samji, also stars Pooja Hegde.

140.title: K'taka police open fire as 2 murder accused try to escape; 5 hurt
140.article_body: Two men who're accused of murder and three police personnel were injured after police opened fire at the accused when they tried to escape in Karnataka's Mangaluru. Out of three rounds of fire, one was shot in air and two at the accused, the city's Police Commissioner N Shashi Kumar said. The duo suffered injuries to their legs, he added.

141.title: Google Maps rolls out new feature to check Air Quality Index of a locality
141.article_body: Google Maps has rolled out a new feature that will show the Air Quality Index of an area on both Android and iOS devices. In India, Google is sourcing data from the Central Pollution Control Board, as well as State Pollution Control Board. The Air Quality feature can be accessed on the app through the layer settings option.

142.title: Intent was there to be bit more aggressive: Conway on NZ innings in 2nd Test
142.article_body: After New Zealand posted 318/4 on Day 1 of the second Test against England, Kiwi batter Devon Conway spoke about the team's aggressive intent. "We spoke about in our batting meetings between Tests was to try and be a bit more aggressive," Conway said. He added, "We were probably lacking that a bit in the first Test."

143.title: Zelenskyy didn't want to hear warnings about Russian invasion: Biden
143.article_body: US President Joe Biden said that his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy "didn't want to hear" American intelligence warnings that indicated Russia was about to invade his country. Biden added that he knew "a lot of people thought he was exaggerating" when he said reports had revealed Russian President Vladimir Putin "was going to go in, off the border".

144.title: 16-yr-old Praggnanandhaa wins chess title in Norway
144.article_body: Indian Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa won the Norway Chess Group A open chess tournament. The 16-year-old chess champion remained unbeaten through the nine rounds and finished with 7.5 points. Notably, Praggnanandhaa (Elo 2642) finished a full point ahead of second-placed players. "He was the top seed, so it is not a surprise that he won the tournament," coach RB Ramesh said.

145.title: 8 killed, 2 rescued as vehicle falls into pond in Bihar's Purnia
145.article_body: As many as eight people were killed on Saturday after the vehicle they were travelling in fell into a pond in Kanjia village of Bihar's Purnia district, police said. "They were coming from Tarabadi and going to Kishanganj when it happened. Two people were safely rescued. Bodies...sent for postmortem," police added. The driver lost control over the vehicle, police stated.

146.title: Huawei India CEO, 3 other execs summoned by Delhi court in IT case
146.article_body: A Delhi court has summoned Huawei India CEO Li Xiongwei and three other executives in a complaint filed by the Income Tax Department accusing them of withholding sought information. "The non-compliance...had resulted in obstruction and stifling of search action of...officers," the court said. The court observed that the officials "deliberately chose to give vague answers" to IT officials.

147.title: Redeveloping 500 km Delhi roads with European standards: CM Kejriwal
147.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal held a meeting with Denmark's Ambassador to India HE Freddy Svane to discuss air pollution, groundwater recharge and the development of world-class road infrastructure on Friday. "We are redeveloping 500 km of Delhi's roads on a par with European standards," he said. "We can collaborate with Denmark on the road beautification project if required," Kejriwal added.

148.title: Desilting of drains to be complete by June 15; 96% work done: MCD
148.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi is likely to finish the work on the desilting of drains by June 15. The MCD claimed that the work is underway on "war-footing" and the corporation has completed 96% of the total work so far. Notably, so far, MCD has removed more than 87,000 metric tonnes of silt from 688 drains.

149.title: Video of brawl between fans in stands during India-SA T20I in Delhi surfaces
149.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a section of spectators fighting in the stands during India-South Africa T20I in Delhi. Security officials had to intervene to stop the fight. Reacting to the video, a fan wrote, "Just a normal seen in Kotla East stand." The reason behind the fist fight is not known.

150.title: Woman reunited with son switched at birth 3 yrs ago at Assam hospital
150.article_body: Following a court directive, a woman was reunited with her son three years after he was switched at birth at a government-run hospital in Assam's Barpeta. The incident had occurred due to the similarity between the names of the two women. The two women had both given birth at the hospital, however, one of the infants was stillborn.

151.title: Navi Mumbai Traffic Police destroy 82 high-volume modified silencers
151.article_body: Navi Mumbai Traffic Police on Friday cracked down on two-wheelers having modified high-volume silencers and seized 82 silencers. Following a special drive by Seawoods traffic branch, the silencers were crushed in front of civic headquarters in Belapur. "Strict action will also be taken against garage owners who install such silencers," said Deputy Police Commissioner (Traffic) Purushottam Karad.

152.title: Radio station owned by 'Putin's favourite oligarch' hacked to play Ukrainian anthem
152.article_body: A Russian radio station was hacked and the Ukrainian anthem and anti-war songs were played instead of its news broadcast. Kommersant FM is owned by the Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov, the fifth richest person in Russia, whom the European Union described as "one of Russian President Vladimir Putin's favourite oligarchs."

153.title: Pakistan penalised 5 runs against West Indies due to illegal fielding
153.article_body: Pakistan were penalised five runs against West Indies in second ODI after illegal fielding by Babar Azam. The Pakistan captain was spotted to have picked up a wicketkeeping glove from Muhammad Rizwan and used it to collect a throw behind stumps. As per rules, no fielder other than the wicketkeeper shall be permitted to wear gloves or external leg guards.

154.title: US woman who caught STD from partner in his car to get ₹40 crore from insurance firm
154.article_body: A US woman was awarded $5.2 million (over ₹40 crore) in a settlement from an insurance company after contracting a sexually transmitted disease (STD) from her partner in his vehicle, which was insured by the company. The woman from Missouri said she contracted human papillomavirus (HPV) from her partner, according to court documents.

155.title: Hardik will be India's game-changer in every single match: Gavaskar
155.article_body: Talking about all-rounder Hardik Pandya, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said," He...[will] be the game-changer for India...in all the matches that are due to come, not just the World Cup but every single match." Gavaskar added that Hardik will be India's game-changer whether he bats at number five, whether he comes to bowl "at first change or second change".

156.title: India's space mission biggest recognition of Aatmanirbhar Bharat: PM Modi
156.article_body: Addressing the inauguration of IN-SPACe in Ahmedabad's Bopal, Prime Minister Narendra Modi called India's space mission the biggest recognition of the Aatmanirbhar Bharat initiative. "IN-SPACe will give a platform to the youth of India and the best scientific minds of the country to showcase their talent," he said. "IN-SPACe has the potential to revolutionise India's space industry," the PM added.

157.title: Want to be number one & will reach that goal: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
157.article_body: Kartik Aaryan in an interview said, "With...success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', reading...[headlines] like 'Rise of a Superstar' or 'Era of Kartik Aaryan' makes me proud, but they also ground me." "It's a long journey, so I've to update myself. I want to be number one...I'll reach that goal," he added. The film has earned ₹163.15 crore in India so far.

158.title: Not shocked by Maharashtra RS poll results: Sharad Pawar
158.article_body: After BJP won three Rajya Sabha seats from Maharashtra on Friday, NCP supremo Sharad Pawar has said that the results haven't come as "shocking" to him. "I am not shocked to see the results...(MVA) received the votes as per the quota," Pawar said. "Only Praful Patel (of NCP) received one extra vote...it was from the opposite side," he added.

159.title: Maharashtra to launch ₹200 cr women-focussed fund for startups
159.article_body: Maharashtra will set up a ₹200-crore fund to invest in early-stage deep tech startups from the state, with a focus on women-led and socially relevant startups. It's also planning to launch a seed fund for startups, Manisha Verma, IAS, Principal Secretary of Maharashtra State Innovation Society, said. Maharashtra already has several investment vehicles to make equity investments in startups.

160.title: 4 arrested for stealing 185 mobile phones from shop in Greater Noida
160.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police have arrested four people for stealing 185 mobile phones worth ₹20 lakh from a shop at Kasna in Greater Noida. The accused have been identified as Anand, Hira, Ghanshyam Lal and Sanjeev. Notably, the incident was reported on May 21 when the accused, who worked at nearby shops, entered the shop by cutting its shutter.

161.title: Syria halts flights to & from Damascus after Israeli attack
161.article_body: Syria has halted all flights to and from Damascus International Airport "until further notice" after Israeli airstrikes on Friday damaged the airstrip and a terminal, the Transport Ministry said. One civilian was injured in the attack, state news agency SANA said. According to the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, the airstrikes were targeting "warehouses of Iranian militias" near the airport.

162.title: Sec 144 in Howrah's Uluberia-Sub Division extended till June 15 after violent protests
162.article_body: Section 144 CrPC imposed in and around the stretches of national highways and railway stations under the jurisdiction of Howrah's Uluberia-Sub Division in West Bengal has been extended till June 15. Violent protests broke out on Friday over former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. A BJP office was set on fire in Howrah.

163.title: Fire breaks out at hospital ICU in Delhi's Rohini, patient feared dead
163.article_body: A fire broke out at the ICU of Brahm Shakti Hospital in Delhi's Rohini on Saturday, officials said. A patient, believed to be around 64 years old, is feared to have died. The fire was reported around 4:50 am on the third floor, officials added. The fire broke out apparently due to a short circuit, DCP Rohini said.

164.title: Sunny Deol, Sanjay, Jackie & Mithun team up for 'desi Expendables': Report
164.article_body: Mithun Chakraborty, Sunny Deol, Sanjay Dutt and Jackie Shroff are reportedly teaming up for an action film, which will be directed by Vivek Chauhan. "It's more of...desi Expendables, as all...four men are historically known for having an action image," a source told Pinkvilla. 'The Expendables', which was released in 2010, featured Sylvester Stallone, Jason Statham and Steve Austin, among others.

165.title: Avesh Khan put me under a lot of pressure: Van der Dussen on 75*(46)
165.article_body: Discussing his 75* off 46 balls in South Africa's win against India by seven wickets in the first T20I, Rassie van der Dussen said, "Avesh Khan put me under a lot of pressure." "[He] didn't miss his mark," added Van der Dussen. Talking about being dropped by Shreyas Iyer, the batter stated he knew he had to make India "pay".

166.title: BJP MP urges Amit Shah to deploy central forces in Bengal amid protests
166.article_body: BJP MP Saumitra Khan on Saturday urged Home Minister Amit Shah to deploy central forces in West Bengal amid protests. "To keep the people of Bengal safe, you (Amit Shah) should appoint a central force...and entrust the security of West Bengal to them," Khan wrote in his letter. Notably, internet services were suspended in Howrah following protests on Friday evening.

167.title: Pakistan's Shadab Khan hugs pitch invader after he salutes him, pics go viral
167.article_body: Pakistan all-rounder Shadab Khan hugged a pitch invader after the latter saluted him during the second ODI against West Indies in Multan on Friday. The fan invaded the ground and saluted Shadab, who was batting at the striker's end. The pitch invader then left the ground himself without the security having to escort him.

168.title: Inter-state robbery gang busted in Hyd, valuables worth over ₹26 lakh seized
168.article_body: Hyderabad's Gopalapuram Police on Friday busted an inter-state robbery gang and apprehended six members in connection with the same. Valuables worth over ₹26 lakh, including cash, gold and silver ornaments, were also seized from the accused, police said. The gang used to travel by RTC or private buses posing as passengers and steal valuables from fellow passengers, police added.

169.title: Man falls while trying to board running train in Chennai, saved
169.article_body: Divisional Railway Manager (DRM) Chennai on Friday shared a video of RPF constable, Ram Kisan Meena, saving a man after he fell into the gap between the platform and train while trying to board the train. The video shows the passenger purportedly losing balance while attempting to board the moving train. The DRM also commended Meena for his "brave act".

170.title: I have given all my money to my father, told him to keep me away from it: MI's Tilak
170.article_body: Mumbai Indians' (MI) 19-year-old batting all-rounder Tilak Varma, who was the second-highest run-scorer for the franchise in IPL 2022, said, "I have given it all to my father and told him to keep me away from it." He added, "I know it is too easy to get distracted." Tilak was bought by MI for ₹1.7 crore in the mega auction.

171.title: Kashmiri YouTuber who posted video depicting beheading of ex-BJP leader apologises
171.article_body: Kashmiri YouTuber Faisal Wani who posted a video depicting beheading of ex-BJP leader Nupur Sharma after her remarks on Prophet Muhammad has apologised. "I apologise. I'm extremely sorry if it hurt anyone," he said. Many social media users reported the video to J&K Police urging them to take action against Wani, who later deleted the video.

172.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, traffic jams in Pune
172.article_body: Pune on Friday witnessed heavy rainfall leading to traffic jams and waterlogging across the district. Around 30 tree-felling incidents were reported and a wall collapsed on Karve Road damaging 11 vehicles, an official added. Two people on two-wheelers also narrowly escape after they fell into a manhole, opened by PMC officials due to waterlogging, and were rescued by commuters.

173.title: Lots of outside edges, played down the wrong line: Gavaskar on Ishan's 76
