173.article_body: Sunil Gavaskar said India opener Ishan Kishan, who was the top-scorer in the first T20I against South Africa with 76(48), did not have a smooth start to his innings with a "lot" of outside edges. "Ishan was playing down the wrong line," added Gavaskar. Ishan's 76 comprised 11 fours and three sixes. He scored at a strike rate of 158.33.

174.title: 2 constables booked for beating up man over accident in Meerut
174.article_body: Two constables, who allegedly beat up a man after his tempo hit their motorcycle in Meerut on June 6, were booked on Friday. He had submitted a written complaint at Ganganagar Police Station where the station in-charge allegedly refused to file FIR. They were booked after BJP MLA Dinesh Khatik reportedly threatened to protest if police didn't file an FIR.

175.title: Indian diplomat Amandeep Singh Gill appointed as UN chief's Envoy on Technology
175.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has appointed senior Indian diplomat Amandeep Singh Gill as his Envoy on Technology to coordinate programmes for international digital cooperation. As per the UN, Gill has a "deep knowledge of digital technologies along with a solid understanding of how to leverage the digital transformation responsibly". Gill joined the Indian Foreign Service in 1992.

176.title: Czech police seize 840 kg of cocaine hidden in banana shipment
176.article_body: The Czech Republic Police on Friday seized 840 kilograms (1,852 pounds) of cocaine among bananas delivered to several supermarkets. The street value of the drug is estimated to be more than 2 billion Czech crowns (around $86 million). "The information about the shipment leads outside the Czech Republic, therefore we will use international police and justice cooperation," the police said.

177.title: Hrithik Roshan announces wrap on 'Vikram Vedha', shares pic from set
177.article_body: Hrithik Roshan took to his social media handles on Friday to announce that shooting of the film 'Vikram Vedha' has been completed. He also shared pictures with director duo Gayatri and Pushkar, and with co-star Saif Ali Khan. "Becoming Vedha, good or bad, wouldn't have been possible without the powerful presence of Saif as Vikram," Hrithik wrote alongside the pictures.

178.title: No conclusive evidence yet on SARS-CoV-2 origin: WHO
178.article_body: WHO on Thursday said there's no conclusive evidence to confirm the lab leak theory of SARS-CoV-2 yet. "Wuhan strain of SARS-CoV-2 has animal origin...the genetically related viruses are beta coronaviruses found in Rhinolophus bats in China and Laos," Dr Raman Gangakhedkar said. "We don't know anything about...the intermediate host - from bats to where before transmitting to humans," he added.

179.title: Pant will look back at not using Chahal's 4 overs: Zaheer on 1st T20I
179.article_body: Zaheer Khan said India's stand-in captain Rishabh Pant will look back at his decision to not give Yuzvendra Chahal four overs to bowl in the first T20I against South Africa. "[The] team management will have conversations around [it]," added Zaheer. "Chahal could have created an opportunity...The game would have been different," he stated. South Africa beat India by seven wickets.

180.title: AR Rahman hosts wedding reception for his daughter in Chennai, pics surface
180.article_body: Oscar-winning music composer AR Rahman on Friday hosted a wedding reception for his daughter Khatija Rahman, who got married to live sound engineer Riyasdeen Shaik Mohamed last month. Pictures from the reception in Chennai have surfaced online. The reception was attended by Yo Yo Honey Singh, Manisha Koirala and Sonu Nigam among others.

181.title: 2 men, who stopped on Mumbai's sea link to save bird, killed after being hit by taxi
181.article_body: A businessman and his driver, who got down from their car to save an injured bird on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link, died after being hit by a taxi on May 30, police said. The incident was caught on camera. A case was registered against the taxi driver for rash and negligent driving and he was arrested, police added.

182.title: 2 dead in Ranchi after violent protests over remarks on Prophet; internet suspended
182.article_body: Two people died and 10 others were injured in violent protests in Jharkhand's Ranchi over former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. "One jawan also suffered bullet injuries...is being treated," police said. Ranchi district administration suspended internet services till tomorrow morning and Section 144 of the CrPC has been imposed in 12 police station areas.

183.title: Tesla seeks investor nod for 3-for-1 stock split to make shares more affordable
183.article_body: Tesla on Friday proposed to its shareholders to approve a three-for-one stock split in order to make its shares cheaper for buyers. Tesla shares have fallen nearly 40% since CEO Elon Musk unveiled his stake in Twitter in April. If the shareholders approve Tesla's proposal, it would be the company's first such action after a five-for-one split in August 2020.

184.title: Ukraine today may be East Asia tomorrow: Japanese PM
184.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida warned that "Ukraine today may be East Asia tomorrow" amid growing concerns that China could invade Taiwan. US officials believe that China is closely monitoring how Russia's invasion of Ukraine progresses to assess their own plans when it comes to Taiwan. Last month, US President Joe Biden said America would intervene militarily if China invaded Taiwan.

185.title: K'taka college students clash over Savarkar portrait in classroom
185.article_body: Two groups of college students clashed on Friday at a constituent institute of Mangalore University in Karnataka over a portrait of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar being put up in a classroom. The portrait had been removed by the college earlier as it was mounted without permission, the institute's principal said. Some students were admitted to a hospital, a police officer said.

186.title: Election Commission favoured BJP: Sanjay Raut on Maharashtra RS polls
186.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Saturday alleged that the Election Commission (EC) favoured BJP in the Maharashtra Rajya Sabha elections held on Friday. "EC made our one vote invalid. We objected to two votes, but no action was taken on that," Raut claimed. His reaction came after EC rejected the vote cast by Shiv Sena legislator Suhas Kande.

187.title: BJP's Krishan Lal Panwar, BJP-JJP backed Kartikeya Sharma win in Haryana RS polls
187.article_body: BJP's Krishan Lal Panwar and BJP-Jannayak Janta Party (JJP) backed Kartikeya Sharma won two Rajya Sabha seats in Haryana that went to polls on Friday. "Their success is a victory of democracy...best wishes to them for their new responsibilities in the development of our great nation," Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar tweeted. Congress' Ajay Maken lost the election.

188.title: Indian economy rebounded strongly despite 3 COVID-19 waves: US Treasury report
188.article_body: The US Treasury in its report to Congress stated that the Indian economy rebounded strongly despite three COVID-19 waves. It praised India's COVID-19 vaccination drive and said that the government continued to provide fiscal support to the economy amid the pandemic in 2021. Despite the Omicron outbreak in 2022, economic fallout was limited in India, it added.

189.title: Football owes it to Messi: Man City's Alvarez on FIFA World Cup 2022
189.article_body: Manchester City's Julián Alvarez said football "owes" the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar to Argentina forward Lionel Messi considering "everything he means for football worldwide". "It would be very nice if it could be achieved," added Alvarez. Argentina have been placed along with Poland, Mexico, Saudi Arabia in Group C. Messi won his first ever international trophy in 2021.

190.title: Actress Pranitha Subhash, husband Nithin Raju blessed with a baby girl
190.article_body: Actress Pranitha Subhash and her husband Nithin Raju have been blessed with a baby girl. She took to Instagram on Friday to make the announcement. Pranitha also shared pictures of herself from the hospital with her newborn and wrote, "The last few days have been surreal...ever since our baby girl was born." Several celebrities posted congratulatory comments on the post.

191.title: Dutch government not to sell land to Facebook-parent Meta
191.article_body: The Dutch government will not yet sell land in the city of Zeewolde to Facebook-parent Meta,  ANP reported quoting the country's housing minister. Hugo de Jonge said that the company had not met the conditions to use the land. In March, Meta suspended plans to build a giant data centre in the Netherlands, following political opposition.

192.title: President Kovind pays obeisance at Mata Vaishno Devi shrine with family
192.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind visited the shrine of Shri Mata Vaishno Devi in Jammu and Kashmir's Katra with wife Savita Kovind and daughter Swati on Friday. "The President prayed for peace and prosperity in the country," an official said. Followed by this, he also visited Bhairon Ghati to pay obeisance at the Bhairon Baba Temple.

193.title: 45 stolen two-wheelers recovered in Pune, 4 arrested
193.article_body: The Pune Rural Police have busted a gang of inter-state vehicle thieves and have recovered 45 stolen two-wheelers from their possession. The accused are identified as Pramod Lakshman Sarkunde (26), Dnyaneshwar Ranganath Bibve (22), Ganesh Fakkad Karkhile (23) and Adil Qureshi (21). Notably, 34 crimes registered at various police stations have been solved with the accused's arrest, police said.

194.title: I have performed there, I couldn't breathe: Arjun Kanungo on venue of KK's last concert
194.article_body: Singer Arjun Kanungo has revealed that he had once performed at the Kolkata venue where KK performed before passing away aged 53. "I did hear the auditorium was extremely hot. I have performed [there] before...I couldn't breathe...It was so hot, the ACs weren't working," he said. Kanungo added, "These older auditoriums are not maintained well. It’s a multi-varied problem."

195.title: Six lands directly into spectator's beer glass during England-NZ Test, video goes viral
195.article_body: A video went viral showing New Zealand batter Daryl Mitchell's six landing directly into a spectator's beer glass on Day 1 of second England-New Zealand Test at Trent Bridge. Reacting to it, commentator Nasser Hussain said, "What does the local beer do to Duke's ball do we know?" The woman was later given a replacement pint by New Zealand team.

196.title: India sees its highest daily COVID-19 cases in over 3 months as 8,329 test positive
196.article_body: India saw 8,329 new COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This is the highest daily tally in over 3 months. Active cases in the country have crossed the 40,000-mark, while the COVID-19 death toll has risen to 5,24,757.

197.title: Punjab minister sits on SUV's roof, policemen seen out of windows; video surfaces
197.article_body: A video showing Punjab Transport Minister Laljit Singh Bhullar sitting on his SUV's roof and his security personnel out of windows has surfaced on social media. Admitting his mistake, Bhullar apologised and said, "The video was made around three months ago when I was declared elected on day of counting of the votes."

198.title: Revlon shares post biggest one-day drop on reports of firm nearing bankruptcy filing
198.article_body: New York-based cosmetics company Revlon is preparing to file for bankruptcy next week amid its supply chain problems and heavy debt load, as per reports. Notably, on Friday, Revlon's shares crashed 53% to close at $2.05, its biggest one-day drop on record. As of March-end, Revlon had long-term debt of $3.31 billion.

199.title: Canada to suspend random COVID testing at airports to reduce wait times
199.article_body: The Canadian government said that it's suspending random COVID-19 testing at all its airports from June 11 to June 30 to ease the long wait times that travellers have encountered in recent weeks. The random testing will resume "off-site" on July 1. We'll continue to "implement solutions to reduce delays as we approach the summer peak season", the government added.

200.title: Pune Police arrests Haryana-based techie for committing thefts
200.article_body: The Pune Police have arrested a thief, who holds a BTech degree, for allegedly committing thefts. The accused, identified as Twinkle Arjun Arora (30), is a resident of Haryana's Ballabhgarh and had come to Pune to participate in a cricket tournament last month. Notably, Arora is suspected to have taken up criminal acts after losing money in IPL betting.

201.title: Custodial deaths show police are becoming mad: Madras High Court
201.article_body: Custodial deaths show that the police are becoming mad, Madras High Court on Friday said. "They organise gangs in the name of police. They involve in land grabbing, rape, custodial deaths...all such acts should be checked for good governance," it added. The Police Complaints Authority must be headed by a retired judge of the High Court, Madras HC further said.

202.title: 35-yr-old man held for molesting woman at railway station in Mumbai
202.article_body: A 35-year-old man from Madhya Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly touching a woman inappropriately and trying to kiss her forcibly at Khar railway station in Mumbai. The incident took place on Thursday when the woman was waiting for a train, an official said. Notably, this is the second incident wherein a woman was molested on the Western Railway network.

203.title: BJP wins 3 seats in Maha Rajya Sabha elections; Shiv Sena, Cong, NCP 1 each
203.article_body: BJP has won three out of the six seats in Maharashtra Rajya Sabha elections, while Shiv Sena, Congress and NCP have won one seat each. All three BJP candidates, Piyush Goyal, Anil Bonde and Dhananjay Mahadik won. From the Maha Vikas Aghadi coalition, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut, Congress' Imran Pratapgarhi and NCP's Praful Patel won the remaining three seats.

204.title: Nadal's tennis much more entertaining than Federer: Ex-world no. 1 Mats
204.article_body: Ex-world number one Mats Wilander said Rafael Nadal's tennis is "much more" entertaining than Roger Federer and Novak Djokovic's gameplay. "With Federer, everything seems easy. It's simple and aesthetic. Nadal is different: his true personality arises when the racquet hits the ball," added Mats. "Previously, there was a repetitive aspect to Nadal's game...Now he creates uncertainty," stated Mats.

205.title: Minor girl sexually assaulted by neighbour in Hyd, accused arrested
205.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested a man for allegedly sexually assaulting a minor girl, repeatedly for the last three days. According to police, the accused lives near the victim's house and had called her on the pretext of fetching him cigarettes from a nearby shop. He then took the victim inside his house and sexually assaulted her, police added.

206.title: Bolivian court finds ex-Prez Anez guilty of coup, jailed for 10 yrs
206.article_body: A Bolivian court has found ex-President Jeanine Anez guilty of orchestrating a coup that brought her to power in 2019. She has been sentenced to 10 years in prison. She'd come to power in 2019 after ex-President Evo Morales resigned following mass protests over a disputed election in which he claimed to win a controversial fourth consecutive term in office.

207.title: Karnataka makes face masks mandatory in public places amid rising COVID-19 cases
207.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases, the Karnataka government on Friday issued fresh COVID-19 guidelines. It has now made the wearing of face masks mandatory in malls, closed-door events, hotels, pubs, restaurants, educational institutions, cafeterias, factories, offices, hostels and public transport. Karnataka on Friday reported 525 new COVID-19 cases with 494 cases in Bengaluru alone.

208.title: Meta probing Sheryl for using company resources to plan wedding, write her book: Report
208.article_body: Meta is investigating outgoing COO Sheryl Sandberg's use of company resources over several years, as per a report. Sheryl reportedly had her subordinates help write her book and promote her foundation on company time. She is also being probed for using company resources for her upcoming wedding, however, the report said it was a small part of the investigation.

209.title: Bengaluru police remove political banner on road sign, share pics
209.article_body: Following a complaint by a Twitter user over a political banner being put up on a road sign, Bengaluru's Malleshwaram traffic police on Friday tweeted that it has removed the banner. The traffic police also shared pictures of the same. "Flex banners have mushroomed across the city, with political functionaries using them for their 'Advertisement'," the Twitter user had said.

210.title: Britney Spears shares pics from her wedding with Sam Asghari, says 'I had a panic attack'
210.article_body: Singer Britney Spears shared video and pictures from her wedding with Sam Asghari. "It was the most spectacular day! I was so nervous all morning but then at 2:00 pm it really hit me...We're getting married! I had a panic attack and then got it together," she wrote on Instagram. She added, "So many incredible people came...I'm still in shock."

211.title: What is Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, rare condition that paralysed half of Justin Bieber's face?
211.article_body: Justin Bieber revealed he has been diagnosed with Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, which has paralysed half of his face. The syndrome is a neurological condition caused by varicella zoster virus. It occurs when a shingles outbreak affects facial nerve near one ear. Its symptoms include, severe pain in ear, painful rash on eardrum and weakness on one side of the face.

212.title: PMC identifies 16 illegally run schools, warns against admission
212.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) Education Department has identified 16 schools which have been running illegally in the civic body's jurisdiction. "It's a serious issue and our appeal to all the parents would be not to take admission in these schools," the district's deputy director of education said. This is in addition to 27 other illegal schools identified earlier in Pune.

213.title: Justin Bieber reveals he has facial paralysis due to Ramsay Hunt Syndrome, shares video
213.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber took to Instagram to reveal he's suffering from facial paralysis due to Ramsay Hunt Syndrome. "As you can see this eye is not blinking...I can't smile on this side of my face...So there's full paralysis on [right] side of my face," he said in a video. Bieber said he doesn't know how long it'll take to recover.

214.title: Who is Choe Son-hui, North Korea's 1st female Foreign Minister?
214.article_body: North Korea's first female Foreign Minister Choe Son-hui is a veteran diplomat who formerly served as Vice Foreign Minister. Choe served as a close aide to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un during nuclear talks with US and accompanied him to summits with then US President Donald Trump. Choe was tapped to lead the ministry at a meeting overseen by Kim.

215.title: Pakistan to ban govt officials from buying new cars to secure IMF bailout
215.article_body: In a bid to secure IMF bailout money amid its financial crisis, Pakistan will raise taxes on the rich and will impose a ban on government officials from buying new cars. Pakistan will now impose a 2% additional tax on individuals with an annual income of PKR 30 million. The nation will also privatise government assets amid the ongoing crisis.

216.title: Will request Haryana for more water on humanitarian grounds: Delhi CM
216.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has said that he would request Haryana to release more water on humanitarian grounds. Delhi's water production has fallen by around 100 million gallons per day, Delhi Jal Board (DJB) vice-chairman Saurabh Bharadwaj said. The level of water at Wazirabad pond has dropped from the normal of 674.5 feet to 667.7 feet, Bharadwaj added.

217.title: 120 kg of poppy seized from a truck in J&K's Udhampur
217.article_body: Police seized 120 kg of poppy from a truck on Jammu-Srinagar National Highway in Udhampur district, officials said. During a routine check, a police team intercepted a truck in which a special cabin was detected in a toolbox, inside which five bags of poppy were found, the officials added. The truck driver escaped from the spot, police said.

218.title: 90-year-old unvaccinated woman dies of COVID-19 in MP's Indore
218.article_body: A 90-year-old woman, who had not been vaccinated against COVID-19, died of the infection in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, a health official said. The woman was suffering from high blood pressure and other ailments for a long time. She was admitted to a hospital, where she tested positive for COVID-19 and died on Thursday, the Chief Medical and Health Officer said.

219.title: Sadhguru has shown power of Indian soil to the world: MP CM
219.article_body: Addressing the 'Mitti Bachao Jan-Jagran' programme, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said Isha Foundation founder Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev has shown the power of Indian soil to the world. He added that Madhya Pradesh will work step-by-step in his 'Save Soil' campaign. "Our goal is to strengthen the ecosystem by maintaining the natural balance," Chouhan said.

220.title: 4 men rob Punjab businessman of ₹1 crore cash at gunpoint
220.article_body: Four men entered an office in Punjab's Dera Bassi on the pretext of meeting a property dealer, threatened him at gunpoint and escaped with a bag containing ₹1 crore in cash. Police said the businessman, Harjit Nagpal, sold his ancestral property and had the cash with him. While escaping, the accused shot a food vendor who tried to catch them.

221.title: 22-year-old man arrested for rape & murder of minor in Kota
221.article_body: Police said that a 22-year-old man was arrested for murdering a minor, whose mutilated body was found two days after she went missing from Rajasthan's Kota. The 17-year-old victim had befriended the accused on social media, Kota SP Kesar Singh said. The accused raped the victim and murdered her after she decided to end the relationship with him, Singh added.

222.title: PM Modi meets his 88-year-old former teacher in Gujarat, pic goes viral
222.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday met with his former teacher Jagdish Nayak during his one-day visit to Gujarat. A picture of the PM with 88-year-old Nayak went viral online. "Though it was a short meeting, I do not have words to describe how I felt," said Nayak. "His (PM's) respect and feelings for me have not changed," he added.

223.title: It's wrong to say 4th COVID-19 wave is coming: ICMR official amid case surge
223.article_body: It's not right to say that the fourth wave of COVID-19 is coming in India, ADG of the Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR) said on Friday, amid a rise in COVID-19 cases. "We need to examine district-level data. A high number of cases in a few districts can't be considered a uniform increase," said Dr Samiran Panda.

224.title: ED issues fresh summons to Sonia Gandhi for appearance on June 23
224.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has issued fresh summons to Congress chief Sonia Gandhi to appear before it for questioning on June 23 in an alleged money laundering case related to newspaper National Herald, officials said. Earlier this week, Sonia had sought more time from the agency to appear before it as she was still recovering from COVID-19.

225.title: SRK teared up, told NCB 'We've been painted as monsters' after Aryan's arrest: Report
225.article_body: Speaking to India Today, Sanjay Singh, NCB's DDG (operations), revealed Shah Rukh Khan met him and raised concerns about Aryan Khan when he was in custody. "Almost in tears, Shah Rukh...told Sanjay, 'We've been painted as...big criminals or monsters who are out to destroy society'," said India Today. "We find going to work tough every day," he reportedly said.

226.title: Ukraine calls for more weapons from the West to fight Russian forces
226.article_body: Ukraine on Friday sought more help from the West, including quicker deliveries of weapons, to fight the advancing Russian forces. "Everything now depends on what (the West) gives us. Ukraine has one artillery piece to 10 to 15 Russian artillery pieces," a Ukrainian official said. Recently, Russia had warned the West against supplying weapons to Ukraine.

227.title: No, not T20 as yet: Shastri on picking Umran for T20 World Cup
227.article_body: Asked if pacer Umran Malik should be picked in India's squad for T20 World Cup, Ravi Shastri said, "No, not T20 as yet. Groom him. Take him with your team." He added, "If anything, let him start playing white-ball cricket, that's 50-over cricket, maybe even red-ball cricket." Umran wasn't included in India's playing XI for first T20I against South Africa.

228.title: Kerala Cong protests, seeks CM's resignation over gold smuggling
228.article_body: Kerala Congress leaders protested in the state against CM Pinarayi Vijayan and demanded his resignation over the gold smuggling case. "They are trying to threaten the persons who are ready to give evidence against the CM," Kerala Opposition leader VD Satheesan said.  This comes after the prime accused claimed CM, his wife and daughter were involved in the scam.

229.title: BJP office set on fire in WB's Howrah amid protests, internet suspended in district
229.article_body: BJP office in West Bengal's Howrah was set on fire by those protesting against remarks made by two former BJP leaders on Prophet Muhammad. BJP leader Anirban Ganguly shared a video of the vandalised office and sought action against the rioters. Following the incident, internet services were suspended till 6 am on June 13 (Monday).

230.title: 8 men risk having their fingers cut off after being convicted of theft in Iran
230.article_body: Eight Iranian men convicted of theft are in risk of having their fingers on one hand cut off, an NGO warned, decrying the punishment as "inhuman". Authorities have reportedly informed the men that they will be transferred to a prison with a guillotine machine in the coming days. "We call on the international community to urgently intervene," said Amnesty International.

231.title: India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage crosses 194 cr
231.article_body: The Union Health Ministry said that the cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country crossed 194.90 crore on Friday. More than 13 lakh coronavirus vaccine doses have been administered till 7 pm today, it added. Notably, over 3.50 crore children in the age group of 12-14 years have been administered the first dose so far.

232.title: No idea: Raducanu on playing Wimbledon after being injured in Nottingham
232.article_body: US Open champion Emma Raducanu said she has "no idea" whether she'll be fit enough to compete at this year's Wimbledon after suffering a "freak" injury in first round at Nottingham Open on Tuesday. The 19-year-old was trailing 4-3 in first set against Switzerland's Viktorija Golubic when she retired with what appeared to be a side strain or rib injury.

233.title: Govt issues new guidelines to curb misleading ads, violators to face ₹10 lakh fine
233.article_body: The government has released new guidelines to prevent false and misleading ads. The new guidelines define 'bait advertisement', 'surrogate advertisement' and 'free claims advertisement'. It lays down provisions regarding ads targeting children and bars Indian and foreigner professionals from endorsing brands. Violation of these guidelines may lead to up to ₹10 lakh penalty for first offence.

234.title: When US sneezes, world catches a cold: Kotak as US inflation hits 40-yr-high
234.article_body: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak tweeted, "Let's remember that when US sneezes, the world catches a cold," after US inflation reached 8.6% in May. It's the highest level of inflation recorded in US in over 4 decades as gas, food, and shelter prices continue to surge. "Cannot believe average Fed funds rate still below 1% pa," Kotak further said.

235.title: Quad important for free and open Indo-Pacific: Japanese PM
235.article_body: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida on Friday said that the four-nation Quad grouping of the US, India, Japan and Australia is playing an important role in promoting a free and open Indo-Pacific. Kishida made the comment at a defence conclave in Singapore. Notably, leaders of Quad countries had met for a summit last month in Japan.

236.title: 109 arrested in UP after violent protests over remarks on Prophet
236.article_body: A total of 109 people were arrested on Friday after protests erupted in parts of Uttar Pradesh over remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. CM Yogi Adityanath has instructed officials to take "stringent action against anti-social elements". Incidents of stone-pelting and sloganeering were reported, following which police used tear gas and resorted to lathicharge to disperse mobs.

237.title: Concerned about temporary blip in LIC share price: Govt as stock hits record low
237.article_body: The government is "very concerned about the temporary blip in LIC share price", DIPAM Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey said as the state-run insurer's shares hit record low on Friday. Shares of LIC touched all-time low of ₹708.05, wiping out over ₹1.51 lakh crore in investors' wealth since listing. Pandey said that the LIC management will raise the shareholders' value.

238.title: 2 tigers die in a single day in MP's Panna Tiger Reserve
238.article_body: Two tigers died in Madhya Pradesh's Panna Tiger Reserve (PTR) in a single day on Thursday, officials said. "The tiger P-111 was over 13 years old and was suffering from kidney disease...The 10-month-old cub P-234 died in a territorial fight," PTR Field Director Uttam Kumar Sharma said. The body of the cub had scratch marks, officials added.

239.title: Maintain peace: Maha minister amid protest over Prophet remarks
239.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil urged people to maintain peace and cooperate with the police in maintaining law and order. His appeal came after protests erupted in parts of Maharashtra against controversial remarks by a former BJP leader on Prophet Muhammad. Patil said the state government and the Home Department have taken a serious note of Nupur Sharma's remarks.

240.title: S African Prez urges probe into money laundering claims against him
240.article_body: After being accused of money laundering by a former intelligence official, South African President Cyril Ramaphosa said that the police should be allowed to investigate him. The ex-official claimed that money laundering by Ramaphosa had come to light after robbers stole "millions" from the President's game farm in 2020. Notably, Ramaphosa claimed the money had come from a legitimate source.

241.title: Russia & China open first cross-border road bridge as ties deepen
241.article_body: Russia and China on Friday unveiled the first road bridge between the two countries, according to state media. Notably, this comes amid deepening ties between the two countries in response to tensions with the West over several issues. The bridge links the Russian city of Blagoveshchensk to the Chinese city of Heihe across the Amur river.

242.title: Never imagined my nephew Nadal would win everything he has won: Toni
242.article_body: Twenty two-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal's uncle and ex-coach Toni Nadal said he never imagined that his nephew would win everything he has won. "I'm surprised by what Rafa does, that with the pain he has, he's able to think about the ball and not about his foot," he added. Nadal has been dealing with a chronic foot problem.

243.title: LIC stock hits all-time low, wipes off ₹1.5 lakh cr investor wealth since listing
243.article_body: LIC stock hit record lows of ₹708.05 on NSE and ₹708.80 on BSE on Friday, down over 25% from its issue price of ₹949. LIC's market capitalisation fell to ₹4.49 lakh crore at the end of trade on Friday from ₹6 lakh crore, BSE data showed. LIC shareholders lost ₹1.51 lakh crore in less than a month of its listing.

244.title: Mumbai logs 1,956 new COVID-19 cases, highest since Jan; positivity rate at 12.7%
244.article_body: Mumbai on Friday reported 1,956 new COVID-19 cases, which is the highest daily rise in infections since January 23. The daily rise in cases is also nearly 15% higher than the number of cases reported on Thursday. The city reported a positivity rate of 12.7%, while the number of active COVID-19 cases now stands at 9,191.

245.title: 'My reputation is ruined, did I really deserve it?' Aryan Khan told NCB
245.article_body: Speaking to India Today, Sanjay Singh, NCB's DDG (operations), revealed his conversation with Aryan Khan. As per Sanjay, Aryan told him, "They didn't find any drugs on my person...yet they arrested me. Sir, you've done me great wrong and ruined my reputation." "Why did I have to spend so many weeks in jail- did I really deserve it?" he said.

246.title: Sitharaman & 2 other BJP leaders win in K'taka Rajya Sabha polls, Cong wins 1 seat
246.article_body: Three BJP candidates bagged Rajya Sabha seats from Karnataka in polls for the Upper House held on Friday, while the remaining one seat went to a Congress candidate. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Kannada comedian Jaggesh and Karnataka Legislative Council member Lehar Siroya were BJP's winning candidates. Congress' Jairam Ramesh won the remaining seat that went to the polls on Friday.

247.title: 6-time world champion Mary Kom ruled out of Commonwealth Games 2022
247.article_body: India's six-time world champion boxer Mary Kom has been ruled out of Commonwealth Games (CWG) 2022, the Boxing Federation of India announced. The 39-year-old boxer suffered an injury on the second day of the ongoing CWG trials in Delhi. She twisted her left knee during the Round 1 of her bout against Nitu. Nitu was declared winner of the bout.

248.title: Malaysia to abolish mandatory death penalty: Law Minister
248.article_body: Malaysia's Law Minister has said that the country will abolish the mandatory death penalty and allow judges to set alternative punishments for a range of offences. The Cabinet also agreed to study substitute sentences for all offences carrying the death penalty, the minister added. Notably, over 1,300 people are on death row in Malaysia, with most cases involving drug trafficking.

249.title: Congress wins 3 seats, BJP 1 in Rajasthan Rajya Sabha elections
249.article_body: The Congress has won three out of four seats, while BJP has won the remaining one in the Rajasthan Rajya Sabha elections. Zee TV Founder and independent candidate Subhash Chandra, who was backed by the BJP, has lost the elections. "Congress' victory in three Rajya Sabha seats in Rajasthan is a victory for democracy," Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot tweeted.

250.title: India's campaign ends after Sindhu crashes out of Indonesia Masters 2022
250.article_body: PV Sindhu has crashed out of 2022 Indonesia Masters Super 500 tournament, ending India's campaign on Friday. Fourth-seeded Sindhu lost to fifth-seeded Ratchanok Intanon 12-21, 10-21 in the women's singles quarter-final. The match lasted 33 minutes. This was Sindhu's fifth straight loss against Intanon. The Indian shuttler is now 4-9 in head-to-head against her Thai opponent.

251.title: Show cause notices to 102 Assam schools over poor Class 10 results
251.article_body: The Assam Secondary Education Department has served show cause notices to 102 schools run by the state government for poor results of their students in the Class 10 examinations. Secondary Education Director Mamata Hojai said the schools' pass percentage was 10% and below. "Out of 102 schools, 25 schools have shown 0% results," Hojai added.

252.title: Sri Lanka could face full-blown humanitarian emergency, says UN
252.article_body: Speaking about the severe economic crisis in Sri Lanka, the UN on Friday said, "We're concerned that this could develop into a full-blown humanitarian emergency." "The Sri Lankan economy is on the brink of collapse," it added. Sri Lankans have been facing daily blackouts, long queues for petrol and record inflation for the past few months due to the crisis.

253.title: He tried to stay ahead of the game: Smith on Pant's T20I captaincy debut
253.article_body: Praising Rishabh Pant following his captaincy debut for India against South Africa in first T20I, ex-South Africa skipper Graeme Smith said it was a "good night in terms of decision-making" and he'll gain "quite a bit of confidence" from it. "He tried to stay ahead of the game," Smith added. South Africa beat India by seven wickets on Thursday.

254.title: Pictures from Britney Spears' wedding with Sam Asghari surface online
254.article_body: Britney Spears and Sam Asghari tied the knot on Thursday at their Thousand Oaks home in Los Angeles. Photos from their wedding ceremony, which have surfaced online, show her wearing a long white Versace gown. Guests at the wedding included Selena Gomez, Madonna, Drew Barrymore, Paris Hilton, Donatella Versace and Will.i.am.

255.title: We'll strictly blacklist those leaving us for money: Allen Co-founder to educators
255.article_body: Allen Career Institute's Co-founder Brajesh Maheshwari, in a video shared with employees, said the institute will "strictly blacklist" educators who are leaving Allen because of "greed for money". He added, "They should better understand that they will never be allowed to come back to Allen ever." Maheshwari's remarks come after edtech unicorn Unacademy opens its offline centre in Kota.

256.title: I'd have Karthik in at that 5 or 6 slot in India's T20 WC squad: Ponting
256.article_body: Ricky Ponting said he would pick wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik in India's squad for T20 World Cup 2022. "I'd have him in at that five or six roles. The way...he finished games for RCB this year, he took his game to another level," he added. Karthik scored 330 runs in 16 matches at a strike rate of 183.33 in IPL 2022.

257.title: Jama Masjid protest held without permit, will take legal action: Delhi Police
257.article_body: After a protest erupted at Delhi's Jama Masjid on Friday against alleged inflammatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad, police said they have identified some "miscreants" behind the agitation. "Protests were done on the street without any permission, so legal action will be taken," DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan said. Chauhan added that police brought the situation under control within 10-15 minutes.

258.title: What is Amyloidosis, the condition that Pak's ex-Prez Pervez Musharraf is suffering from?
258.article_body: Former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf is suffering from Amyloidosis, his family said. It's a rare disease that occurs when amyloid proteins are deposited in tissues and organs. Amyloid proteins are abnormal proteins the body cannot break down and recycle. Buildup of amyloid deposits damages organs and tissues and it most frequently affects kidneys, heart, nervous system and liver.

259.title: Will not hesitate to start war over Taiwan, China tells US
259.article_body: Beijing will "not hesitate to start a war" if Taiwan declares independence, China's Defence Minister warned his US counterpart Lloyd Austin. This came as Wei Fenghe held his first face-to-face meeting with Austin on sidelines of Shangri-La Dialogue security summit in Singapore. Fenghe vowed Beijing would "smash to smithereens any 'Taiwan independence' plot", said Chinese Defence Ministry.

260.title: MP man carries 4-yr-old daughter's body after being denied hearse
260.article_body: A man in Madhya Pradesh's Chhattarpur district was purportedly seen carrying the body of his four-year-old daughter, as he was unable to find an ambulance. The girl's grandfather claimed that the family had also asked for a hearse at the Damoh district hospital, but was not provided one by authorities. A civil surgeon at the hospital has denied the claim.

261.title: Tourist causes ₹20 lakh in damage to Roman heritage site by throwing e-scooter
261.article_body: An American tourist caused damages worth £21,000 (around ₹20 lakh) after she deliberately threw an e-scooter down the famous 18th-century Spanish steps in Rome. The 28-year-old and her 29-year-old male companion were fined £343 (around ₹33,000) each over the incident. The 16th and 29th steps of the UNESCO World Heritage site were damaged and other sections were also chipped.

262.title: Body of man who fell from Sikkim bridge while clicking pics found
262.article_body: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) has recovered the body of a local driver, who fell into the riverbed from Sikkim's Rit Chu Bridge while clicking pictures. The driver, along with a tourist, was clicking pictures while standing at the edge of the bridge when they both lost balance and fell. Search for the missing tourist from Bihar is underway.

263.title: PM Modi unveils development projects worth ₹3,050 crore in Gujarat
263.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday inaugurated and laid the foundation stone of multiple development projects worth ₹3,050 crore during 'Gujarat Gaurav Abhiyan' programme in Gujarat's Navsari. These projects are aimed at improving the water supply in the region, along with boosting connectivity and enhancing the ease of living. "We treat being in government as an opportunity to serve," he said.

264.title: I was told to get breast implants, botox; it made me angrier: Radhika Apte
264.article_body: Radhika Apte revealed that when she was new in the film industry, she was told "to do lots of jobs" on her body and face. "First meeting I had, I was told to change my nose. Second meeting...I was told to get a boob job...Then I was told to do...botox," she stated. "I never felt pressurised...I felt angrier," said Radhika.

265.title: 4 persons arrested for beating suspected thief to death in Mumbai
265.article_body: Police said that four persons have been arrested for allegedly beating a suspected thief to death in Mumbai's Mulund area. The 28-year-old deceased had entered a house intending to steal valuables, police said. One of the four occupants of the house noticed and caught him, after which all four of them assaulted the victim with wooden sticks, police added.

266.title: India to provide 5,000 tonnes of rice in aid to Madagascar
266.article_body: India has announced that it will provide 5,000 tonnes of rice in aid to Madagascar amid a humanitarian crisis in the country. The announcement comes after a meeting between the Ambassador of India to Madagascar and Comoros, Abhay Kumar, and Madagascar's PM Christian Ntsay. The shipment of rice from India to the island nation is likely to reach in July.

267.title: 30-yr-old Navi Mumbai man arrested, drugs worth ₹60,000 seized
267.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested by the Anti-Narcotics Cell of the Crime Branch in Navi Mumbai's Taloja for selling charas behind a school. Police said they seized 75 grams of charas worth ₹60,000 from the accused. The accused Jai Santosh Gufta was selling drugs to the youth and where he got the drugs from is being investigated, the police added.

268.title: 4 persons arrested for auto driver's murder in Hyderabad
268.article_body: The Hyderabad Police have arrested four persons involved in the murder of an auto driver, who had stopped them from extorting money from a transgender. Charminar ACP G Bhiksham Reddy said the accused attacked the auto driver and his friend on June 5 with knives and liquor bottles. The auto driver succumbed to injuries on the way to the hospital.

269.title: Policeman opens fire in Kolkata, shoots woman before killing self
269.article_body: A policeman allegedly fired several shots using his service rifle outside the Bangladesh Deputy High Commission in Kolkata's Park Circus area on Friday. A woman, who was riding pillion on a two-wheeler, fell down after being hit by a bullet, and died on the spot, police said. The accused policeman later shot himself dead. Preliminary investigations are underway, police added.

270.title: Woman dies on wedding anniversary as bus hits motorbike in Hyd
270.article_body: A 26-year-old woman was killed while her husband escaped with injuries on their wedding anniversary after a bus rammed into their motorbike in Hyderabad on Thursday. "The couple along with their son Bunny went to a temple near Chandanagar and the accident occurred...while they were returning home," police said. The woman's husband and their son were rushed to a hospital.

271.title: Mob in J&K's Bhaderwah defies curfew, pelts stones; CRPF trooper hurt
271.article_body: A mob of around 150 people on Friday morning came out on the streets and pelted stones at security personnel in Bhaderwah town of Jammu and Kashmir's Doda district. A Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) personnel has sustained injuries in the incident. According to a police officer, security forces had to fire tear gas shells to disperse the mob.

272.title: India's Lakshya Sen loses in quarters at Indonesia Masters 2022
272.article_body: India's Lakshya Sen lost to Chou Tien Chen in the quarter-finals of Indonesia Masters Super 500 tournament on Friday. Third-seeded Tien Chen beat the World Championships bronze medallist 21-16, 12-21, 21-14 in one hour two minutes. This was Lakshya's second straight defeat against Tien Chen in less than a month, having lost during the group stage of the Thomas Cup.

273.title: He takes his job seriously: Paytm CEO on 'number of days' timer in MoS IT's office
273.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to share a picture with Minister of State for Electronics & Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar after meeting with him on Friday. "Rarely you will meet someone who takes his job so seriously, and puts a number of days timer," Sharma said, referring to a clock in Chandrasekhar's office.

274.title: Organs malfunctioning, recovery not possible: Pervez Musharraf's family on his health
274.article_body: Former Pakistan President Pervez Musharraf's family, while issuing a statement on his health, said, "He is not on the ventilator. Has been hospitalised for the last 3 weeks due to a complication of his ailment (Amyloidosis)." "Going through a difficult stage where recovery is not possible and organs are malfunctioning. Pray for ease in his daily living," the statement read.

275.title: New Zealand to tax burps of cows & sheep to cut greenhouse gas emissions
275.article_body: New Zealand has released a draft plan to tax sheep and cattle burps in a bid to cut greenhouse gas emissions, making it the first country to do so. Farmers will be charged for the burps of their livestock from 2025. Methane from belching sheep and cattle is among the biggest contributors to greenhouse gas emissions in New Zealand.

276.title: Historians gave prominence to Mughals, ignored Pandyas & Mauryas: Shah
276.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that most of the historians in India have given prominence in recording the history of Mughals, while ignoring the reigns of many empires like Pandyas, Mauryas, Guptas and Ahoms. Reference books should be written on these empires, he added. "Our glorious history should be kept in front of the public," he further said.

277.title: Ranchi policemen hurt amid protest against Prophet remarks; curfew imposed
277.article_body: Some police personnel sustained injuries in Jharkhand's Ranchi on Friday while trying to control an angry mob near a Hanuman temple on the Main Road. Protests broke out in the city over former BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Vehicles were torched and vandalised by protesters and stone-pelting was also reported in Ranchi, where a curfew has now been imposed.

278.title: Lost treasure, gold coins worth billions discovered in centuries-old shipwreck
278.article_body: Colombian Navy has released footage of the San José, a Spanish galleon that sank over 300 years ago. The footage also revealed existence of two other historical wrecks in the water nearby. Images show gold ingots and coins and Spanish cannons dating back to 1655. It's believed the cargo could be worth as much as $17 billion in today's money.

279.title: Avesh can become an excellent bowler in all 3 formats: Gambhir
279.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said India and LSG pacer Avesh Khan has a lot of talent and only the IPL shouldn't be his goal. "If he continues to work hard, he can become an excellent bowler, not only in T20Is but in all three formats," he added. Avesh posted 0/35 in India's seven-wicket loss to South Africa in first T20I.

280.title: Plan was to target loose balls, put pressure on bowlers in 1st T20I: Kishan
280.article_body: Talking about his strategy in India-South Africa first T20I, India opener Ishan Kishan (76) said he wanted to target the loose balls and put pressure on the bowlers. "My plan was to just keep them (Kagiso Rabada and Anrich Nortje) on...backfoot, keep playing my shots so that they're also thinking and...move their line...length," he added. India lost by seven wickets.

281.title: Plastic eating 'superworms' could revolutionise recycling: Study
281.article_body: Researchers have found that Zophobas morio, the larvae of darkling beetle, known as 'superworms' can survive on a diet of polystyrene. They are believed to digest the plastic through gut enzymes. According to researcher Dr Chris Rinke, these 'superworms' are like mini recycling plants that shred polystyrene with their mouth and feed it to the bacteria in their gut.

282.title: Wanted to become music director, not singer: Mika on 'Saawan Mein...'
282.article_body: Mika Singh, while talking about his 1998 song 'Saawan Mein Lag Gayi Aag', said back then he was not serious about becoming a professional singer. "At the time, I wanted to be a music director, and not...singer," Mika said, calling it the reason for not paying attention to his singing. "It didn't matter to me that...song had...nasal tone," Mika added.

283.title: Zinedine Zidane to become PSG coach from next season: Report
283.article_body: Former French captain Zinedine Zidane is likely to become the coach of the Paris St Germain club from next season. According to a French radio station Europe 1 report, the 49-year-old former footballer will replace 50-year-old Argentinian Mauricio Pochettino from next season. Notably, Zidane and PSG were "close to finding an agreement", the report said.

284.title: IIT-Kanpur tool to help UP police detect crypto transaction fraud
284.article_body: IIT Kanpur will be providing a tool, that can analyse cryptocurrency transactions, to the Uttar Pradesh police to detect cases of fraud. The tool, called HOP, is cheaper than any foreign equipment and will be ready for use by September, Professor Sandeep Shukla said. Subhash Chandra, ADG, Cybercrime, stressed on capacity-building for police departments to prepare to counter cybercrimes.

285.title: BJP govt should stop their PR against women's empowerment: TRS leader
285.article_body: TRS leader K Kavitha has questioned BJP over its campaign on women empowerment. "BJP government should for once out of sheer respect for women stop their PR against women's empowerment, when they continue to hide the truth behind extravagant publicity," Kavitha said. She added that BJP should apologise to Anganwadi workers "for slashing their budget by 50%".

286.title: Miracle for any normal person, he's different: Nadal's doctor on him
286.article_body: Rafael Nadal's doctor Ángel Ruiz-Cotorro said competing despite chronic foot pain as being experienced by Nadal would be a "miracle" for any normal person, adding that Nadal can do it as he really is "different". Ruiz-Cotorro stated radiofrequency ablation is being used to help Nadal recover. "We have more options...but they are more aggressive," he said.

287.title: Heatwave warnings issued for several states, IMD releases list
287.article_body: Heatwave condition in isolated places is very likely over Jharkhand during June 10-12 and over Punjab, Haryana-Delhi, Uttar Pradesh and Rajasthan on June 10 and 11. IMD also predicted heatwave in Madhya Pradesh, Chhattisgarh, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana, Odisha on June 10. There's likely to be no significant change in maximum temperatures over northwest and central India during next 48 hours.

288.title: Take the extra mile: Wizz Air CEO asks staff to work through fatigue
288.article_body: European airline Wizz Air's CEO József Váradi is facing criticism after he told his staff that too many crew members were refusing to fly when fatigued. He said, "We're all fatigued but sometimes it is required to take the extra mile...We cannot run this business when every fifth person of a base reports sickness because the person is fatigued."

289.title: Ranbir is 'extremely loving, calls me ma'am': 'Animal' co-star Rashmika
289.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, shared her experience of working with 'Animal' co-star Ranbir Kapoor. "He's extremely loving," Rashmika stated, while calling Ranbir an "easygoing" person. "And he's the only one in the whole industry who calls me "ma'am," and I do not like it," Rashmika added. Directed by Sandeep Reddy Vanga, 'Animal' went on floors in Manali.

290.title: Man throws acid on woman for turning down marriage proposal in B'luru
290.article_body: A 36-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly throwing acid on a woman for turning down his marriage proposal in Bengaluru on Friday, police said. The 32-year-old woman, a divorcee with three children, sustained injuries in her right eye and is undergoing treatment in a private hospital, they added. The victim had known the accused for the past three years.

291.title: No signs of Russian military threat to Sweden & Finland: NATO
291.article_body: NATO's Deputy Secretary-General Mircea Geoana said that at present he sees no immediate military threat from Russia to aspiring NATO members, Sweden and Finland. Geoana also said he's confident that Sweden and Finland will join the military alliance despite Turkey's objection. Turkey has opposed Sweden and Finland's NATO bids accusing them of harbouring Kurdish militants and other terror groups.

292.title: Shutdown in J&K's Srinagar over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet
292.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar observed a shutdown on Friday in protest against former BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Kumar Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Shops and other business establishments remained closed at the Lal Chowk, among other parts of the city. As per reports, authorities suspended mobile internet services in Jammu, while broadband services remained operational.

293.title: Abu Dhabi's ADIA to buy 20% stake in IIFL Home Finance for ₹2,200 cr
293.article_body: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) will invest ₹2,200 crore for a 20% stake in IIFL Home Finance. As of March 31, 2022, IIFL Finance's home loan arm has Assets Under Management of ₹23,617 crore. The deal will reportedly value the lender at ₹11,000 crore. It will mark one of the biggest investments in the affordable housing segment in India.

294.title: Israelis will be allowed to attend FIFA WC in Qatar: Officials
294.article_body: Despite not having formal diplomatic relations with Qatar, Israeli ministers have said that the country's residents will be allowed to visit Qatar for this year's FIFA World Cup. "Love of football and sport connects people and states, and the World Cup in November opens a new door for us to warm ties," Israel's Foreign Minister Yair Lapid said.

295.title: Sham trial: US after 3 foreigners who fought for Ukraine sentenced to death
295.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken raised concern about a "sham trial" after two British fighters and a Moroccan captured while fighting for Ukraine were sentenced to death by a court in the Russian-occupied Donetsk region of Ukraine. "We call on Russia and its proxies to respect international humanitarian law, including the rights and protections afforded prisoners of war," Blinken added.

296.title: Policeman opens fire, kills woman then shoots self dead in WB
296.article_body: An on-duty police officer allegedly shot himself dead after he opened fire outside Bangladesh Deputy High Commission in West Bengal's Kolkata on Friday, police said. A woman, who was riding pillion on a two-wheeler, was hit by a bullet during the firing and died on the spot, police added. "The whole episode lasted for around five minutes," an eyewitness said.

297.title: Govt failed miserably in creating jobs for youth: KTR writes to PM Modi
297.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao has written an open letter to Prime Minister Narendra Modi over the unemployment issue in the country and claimed that the BJP-led central government has failed miserably in creating jobs for the youth. "There are only 'pakoda' employment opportunities in the country today, all thanks to the inefficient policies of the Union government," he stated.

298.title: Sri Lanka creates 2 new ministries to deal with economic crisis
298.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has created two new ministries to deal with the severe economic crisis in the country. The Ministry of Technology and Investment Promotion was created to promote foreign direct investment (FDI) in the country. The Ministry of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment includes 15 national institutions and departments, according to a local report.

299.title: Goldman Sachs CEO shares 5 tips for interns, includes 'Be an entrepreneur'
299.article_body: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon shared some advice with the incoming interns at the global investment bank. In an email, Solomon advised the interns to "take the long view" and "be an entrepreneur". He asked them to "embrace evolution" and to listen and ask questions. "Make time to do things that you want to do because they...excite you," he added.

300.title: Stones pelted in UP's Prayagraj over Prophet remarks row, ADG's car damaged
300.article_body: Massive protests broke in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj on Friday against alleged inflammatory remarks on Prophet Muhammad by former BJP leaders. Police said people raised slogans and pelted stones in Atala area after the Friday prayers ended. The car of Prayagraj ADG, who was on the ground to take control of the law and order situation, was damaged during the protest.

301.title: Massive protests erupt across India over ex-BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet
301.article_body: Protests were held in Delhi and several other cities across India on Friday over ex-BJP leaders Nupur Sharma and Naveen Jindal's remarks on Prophet Muhammad. Protests and stone-pelting were reported in several cities of UP including Lucknow, Saharanpur, Moradabad and Prayagraj. West Bengal's Kolkata, Punjab's Ludhiana, Telangana's Hyderabad, Jharkhand's Ranchi and J&K's Srinagar also saw protests.

302.title: Andre Russell gifts himself Mercedes-Benz AMG GT R after IPL 2022, pics surface
302.article_body: West Indies and KKR all-rounder Andre Russell gifted himself a Mercedes-Benz AMG GT R sports car after IPL 2022. Pictures of Russell standing near his new buy have surfaced. Russell also shared a video, writing, "As a ghetto yute I always dream big! But with hard work and sacrifices, dreams become reality. God is good."

303.title: 28-year-old raped in 5-star hotel in Delhi's Dwarka by man she met on dating app
303.article_body: A 28-year-old woman has alleged that she was raped by a man, whom she met on a dating app, in a five-star hotel in Delhi's Dwarka area, the police said. DCP (Dwarka) M Harsha Vardhan said, "The accused did not answer her calls after that and she lodged an FIR against him. The accused is a resident of Hyderabad."

304.title: Scarlett Johansson to star in Kristin Scott Thomas' 'My Mother's Wedding'
304.article_body: Actress Scarlett Johansson has signed on to star in the upcoming film 'My Mother's Wedding'. The film will mark the feature directorial debut of Kristin Scott Thomas, who has co-written the script with John Micklethwait. According to Deadline, Sienna Miller, Emily Beecham and Freida Pinto will also feature in the movie produced by Finola Dwyer and Steven Rales.

305.title: EU Parliament firmly behind Ukraine’s candidacy bid: Prez Metsola
305.article_body: The European Union's Parliament "stands firmly" behind Ukraine's bid to achieve candidate status to join the European Union, the Parliament's President Roberta Metsola said. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in April completed the first step in obtaining European Union membership for Ukraine by submitting a questionnaire. Ukraine currently has an association agreement with the EU.

306.title: Nick Jonas attends Jimmy Fallon's show with kalawa on his wrist, fans react
306.article_body: Singer Nick Jonas recently attended 'The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon' where he was seen wearing kalawa, a sacred red thread, on his wrist. Reacting to a video of Nick shared by 'The Tonight Show' on their official Instagram handle, a user wrote, "Did someone notice he is wearing a rakhsha dhaga," while another commented, "Work of Priyanka (Chopra)."

307.title: BMC employee befriends woman on FB, rapes her promising financial help
307.article_body: A Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation employee was arrested for allegedly raping a married woman he befriended on Facebook. The woman alleged that the accused promised to help her and her husband with their debt and raped her at a lodge in Chembur. When she threatened to file a complaint, he called her again, promising to pay money but raped her again.

308.title: Ordinance soon on online rummy games, committee formed: TN Govt
308.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government has said that it will soon come up with an ordinance to corner online rummy and other card games. A committee headed by a retired judge has been constituted to look into the matter. Notably, the ordinance is being promulgated to tackle incidents of people ending their lives after losing money in the game.

309.title: Fire breaks out in carpet and crockery factory in Delhi's Hamidpur
309.article_body: A fire broke out in the godown of a carpet and crockery factory in Delhi's Hamidpur on Thursday evening and no casualties were reported, officials said. As many as 23 fire tenders were rushed to the spot to combat the fire. The NOC was not taken from the concerned department while establishing the factory, a Delhi Fire Service official said.

310.title: Today people talk about pan-India stars, I think I was one: Sonali Bendre
310.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre in an interview described herself as a "pan-India star" and added that she has never in her life been appreciated for her performances. "I was very successful in Hindi," she said. "I was very successful in Telugu, Tamil, Maratha, all sorts. So, today you talk about pan-India stars, I think I was one," Sonali further said.

311.title: Jasleen Royal pays tribute to KK by singing 'Yaaron' at concert, shares video
311.article_body: Singer Jasleen Royal paid tribute to late singer KK at one of her recent concerts. She took to Instagram to share a video where she could be seen singing KK's 'Yaaron' at the concert. "Remember singing this with...my school and college friends at the top of our voices...I salute you KK sir! You'll live on forever," Jasleen wrote.

312.title: 2 workers hospitalised after they fall into a chocolate tank at Mars factory in US
312.article_body: Firefighters rescued two workers after they fell into a chocolate tank at the Mars M&M factory in the US. The duo stood waist-deep in chocolate until they were rescued after a hole was cut into the tank to help them exit it. While it is unclear how they fell into the tank, they were later hospitalised.

313.title: Happy to bat wherever and make a difference: Miller on his 64* vs India
313.article_body: David Miller, who scored 64*(31) while batting at number five in South Africa's seven-wicket win against India in first T20I, said he's happy to bat wherever and make a difference. "I've done well at number four in my domestic career but South Africa is a different story with world-class players in...lineup," he added. Miller was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

314.title: Need €500 million to save Barca: Barcelona's Economic Vice Prez
314.article_body: Barcelona's Economic Vice-President Eduard Romeu said a sum of 500 million euros is needed to "save" the club. "You could add 150 million euros to that in losses this season if we [don't] do anything," added Romeu. Barcelona President Joan Laporta Estruch said the club is currently in the "ICU" having been "clinically dead" when he arrived.

315.title: 12-yr-old Bhopal girl abducted for human trafficking, tortured with electric shocks
315.article_body: Police arrested two people for allegedly abducting a 12-year-old schoolgirl from a street in Bhopal and torturing her. The accused, who intended to sell her to repay their debts, reportedly drugged her, stuffed her into a sack and tortured her with electric shocks. She was rescued after a woman, who had heard a single shriek from kidnappers' home, informed police.

316.title: 2 including an 8-yr-old boy killed after being hit by car in UP's Ballia
316.article_body: Two people, including an eight-year-old boy, died and two were injured after being hit by an SUV in Bhojpur village in UP's Ballia. The deceased were identified as Kishan (8) and Devnath (42) while Paswan (30) and Kundan Bharti (9) sustained injuries. Accused were consuming alcohol when they hit the pedestrians before ramming into a tree, police said.

317.title: Shows of Akshay's 'Samrat Prithviraj' cancelled due to zero occupancy: Reports
317.article_body: Shows of Akshay Kumar and Manushi Chhillar starrer 'Samrat Prithiviraj' have recently been cancelled in some cities due to zero occupancy in theatre halls, reports said. The occupancy was reported to be low in Mumbai, Kolkata and Bengaluru, although it performed marginally better in Delhi, Bollywood Hungama reported. The film had opened with ₹10.7 crore earnings on Friday.

318.title: Canada blocks & freezes over $310 mn in Russian assets amid war
318.article_body: Canadian police said they've frozen and blocked over $310 million in Russian assets and transactions from February 24-June 7 involving people sanctioned amid Moscow's war on Ukraine. In April, Canada said it'd change its sanctions law to allow for seized, sanctioned foreign assets to be redistributed as compensation to victims or to help in rebuilding a foreign state from war.

319.title: Cryptos akin to 'a world of Caribbean pirates' without regulation, says CEA
319.article_body: Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) V Anantha Nageswaran said that cryptocurrencies are akin to "a world of Caribbean pirates" in the absence of a centralised regulatory authority. He added that with more decentralisation in crypto, there exists a world of "winners take all". Commenting on the recent collapse of Terra ecosystem, Nageswaran said, "[It's a] very important cautionary tale."

320.title: Sensex crashes over 1,000 points to end at 54,303, logs worst week in a month
320.article_body: The Sensex crashed 1,017 points on Friday to settle at 54,303, while the Nifty closed 276 points lower at 16,201, logging the worst week in a month. The benchmark indices fell as European markets declined ahead of US inflation data. As many as 37 of the Nifty 50 stocks declined on Friday, while 13 of them posted gains.

321.title: 28-year-old raped in Delhi's Dwarka by man she met on dating app
321.article_body: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly raped by a man whom she met on a dating app in Delhi's Dwarka, police said. "A case of rape was registered after they received a complaint from the woman," police added. They went to a hotel where the accused offered the victim a drink laced with sedatives, police further said.

322.title: Aus, New Zealand unite amid China's growing influence in Pacific
322.article_body: After a meeting with New Zealand's PM Jacinda Ardern on Friday, Australia's PM Anthony Albanese said that the two countries are "in lockstep on the Pacific". This comes amid China's growing influence in the region. Australia and New Zealand have voiced concerns that China's security pact with the Solomon Islands could result in a Chinese military base being established there.

323.title: Voted for Cong as I love it: K'taka JD(S) MLA on Rajya Sabha polls
323.article_body: Karnataka JD(S) MLA K Srinivasa Gowda on Friday said he has voted for the Congress in the Rajya Sabha elections. When asked why, Gowda claimed he did so because he "loves the party". Along with Gowda, JD(S) MLA SR Srinivas from Gubbi has also reportedly voted for Congress. Six candidates are in the fray for four RS seats from Karnataka.

324.title: Man deadlifts 129.5 kg with just his middle finger in UK to break Guinness World Record
324.article_body: A man named Steve Keeler from UK has broken the Guinness World Record for the heaviest deadlift with one finger. Using just his middle finger, the Kent-based martial artist deadlifted 129.50 kg for eight seconds. "It’s incredibly painful, but my fingers are strong and I am proud of my lift," the 48-year-old said about his record.

325.title: Rebranded McDonald's in Russia unveils new logo ahead of reopening
325.article_body: The company replacing McDonald's in Russia following its exit from the country has unveiled its new logo. The new logo features a circle and two lines, which are said to represent a burger and two french fries. The business, which was bought for an undisclosed sum by Alexander Govor, is yet to decide on a name for the chain.

326.title: Europe's biggest meat-eating dinosaur discovered on the Isle of Wight
326.article_body: Researchers have discovered fossils of a giant crocodile-faced, meat-eating dinosaur on the Isle of Wight thought to be the biggest dinosaur known in Europe. The 33-foot-long carnivore that lived around 125 million years ago could move quickly and had razor-sharp claws and rows of pointy teeth to munch anything it hunted down. Scientists have nicknamed it as White Rock spinosaurid.

327.title: Laptop, cash stolen from archer Abhishek Verma's wife's car in Delhi
327.article_body: A case has been registered after archer Abhishek Verma's wife's bag containing a laptop, some documents and cash over worth ₹1 lakh was stolen from an Audi car in Delhi's Rohini. Verma said his wife, who was on her way home from office, had parked her car in the area for shopping. The accused had allegedly broken the car's windowpane.

328.title: It was mineral water: Ayesha on Akshay spraying water on her from mouth in song
328.article_body: As her film 'Khiladi' completed 30 years of release, actress Ayesha Jhulka spoke about whether she was apprehensive about doing the shot where Akshay Kumar sprayed water on her from his mouth. Ayesha said, "Well, it was mineral water thrown on my face. So, it was okay." The shot was part of the song 'Kya Khabar Thi Jaana'.

329.title: Bhuvan Bam to make OTT debut with comedy-drama series 'Taaza Khabar'
329.article_body: YouTuber and actor Bhuvan Bam is all set to make his OTT debut with a comedy-drama series titled, 'Taaza Khabar'. Directed by Himank Gaur, the show also stars Shriya Pilgaonkar, JD Chakravarthy, Deven Bhojani, Prathamesh Parab, Nitya Mathur, Shilpa Shukla and Mithilesh Chaturvedi in pivotal roles. Bhuvan said, "I wholeheartedly hope the audience enjoys and cherishes this story."

330.title: 4th seed Sindhu enters quarter-finals of Indonesia Open 2022
330.article_body: Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu entered the quarter-finals of the 2022 Indonesia Masters Super 500 badminton tournament on Thursday. The fourth seed defeated Gregoria Mariska Tunjung of Indonesia 23-21, 20-22, 21-11 in one hour 11 minutes in the second round. Sindhu will now face fifth seed Ratchanok Intanon, who beat unseeded Kirsty Gilmour 21-17, 19-21, 21-15, on Friday.

331.title: 11 vehicles vandalised in Pune's Janata Vasahat area, 5 detained
331.article_body: At least 11 vehicles were vandalised by unidentified persons in the Janata Vasahat area of Pune, police said. Police have registered a case and five persons have been detained in connection with the incident, an officer said. The incident seems to be a fallout of a gang rivalry, the officer added.

332.title: Everyone shuts up when Messi talks, even Argentina's Prez: Martinez
332.article_body: Argentina goalkeeper Emiliano Martinez said "everyone" shuts up when Lionel Messi talks, even the President of Argentina. Messi won his first ever international trophy when Argentina defeated Brazil 1-0 in the Copa America 2021 final. It was the footballer's fourth Copa America final. Messi currently represents PSG in club football having previously played for Barcelona.

333.title: 'Brazil Prez doesn't respect democracy,' says Hulk actor, Brazil Prez replies
333.article_body: Hulk actor Mark Ruffalo criticised Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro ahead of US President Joe Biden's meeting with Bolsonaro, saying, "The man you're meeting...does not respect democracy." Ruffalo added, "[He] consistently threatens a coup." Bolsonaro responded, "I'm sure you've never read the Brazilian Constitution...it's nothing like the complicated Hulk scripts you've to memorise: "AHGFRR"."

334.title: Villagers set 2 men on fire for raping a girl in Jharkhand; 1 dead
334.article_body: Two men, aged 19 and 22, were set ablaze by villagers in Jharkhand's Gumla for allegedly abducting and raping a girl, following which one of the accused succumbed to his injuries, police said. After the incident, the girl's neighbours had become "very violent", a police officer said. "We are in the process of registering two FIRs," the police officer added.

335.title: An actor can't showcase talent without opportunities: Shekhar Suman
335.article_body: Actor Shekhar Suman, while talking about his son Adhyayan's career, said he does not agree with the term 'nepotism'. "I think...time and opportunities matter. An actor is nothing without opportunities," he said, adding that an actor can't showcase their talent if they don't get appropriate opportunities. "It's like a swimmer is asked to swim in...pool without water," Shekhar said.

336.title: Five new countries elected to UN Security Council
336.article_body: The UN General Assembly on Thursday elected Ecuador, Japan, Malta, Mozambique and Switzerland as non-permanent members of the Security Council. Non-permanent members are elected for a two-year term, with the newly-elected members' terms set to begin in January 2023. The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) is composed of 15 members, five permanent and 10 non-permanent.

337.title: Pune police arrest 12 persons for gambling, seize ₹2 lakh-items
337.article_body: Pune police's social security cell arrested 12 people for gambling following raids at various spots and seized materials worth over ₹2 lakh, according to officials. As per police, a total of 22 raids have been conducted and 175 people arrested so far this year. Moreover, a police officer said that mobile gambling has emerged as a "new form of gambling".

338.title: Ex-MP Divya Spandana files complaint over lewd comments in B'luru
338.article_body: Former MP Divya Spandana on Thursday filed a complaint with Bengaluru cyber crime police over alleged lewd comments made against her on social media. Spandana "herself came to...station and registered a complaint," a police officer said. In May, Spandana, who previously also served as Congress' social media head, claimed that Karnataka Congress leadership asked leaders and volunteers to troll her.

339.title: Woman, 17-yr-old son arrested for killing her husband in Delhi
339.article_body: A woman and her 17-year-old son were arrested for allegedly stabbing her husband to death in Delhi's Jwalapuri area. The accused used a pair of scissors and a sharp weapon for murder as she was allegedly fed up with the deceased's frequent domestic abuse. Notably, the accused broke down and admitted to murdering her husband during interrogation, police said.

340.title: Massive protest held at Delhi's Jama Masjid over BJP leaders' remarks on Prophet
340.article_body: A massive protest broke out at Delhi's Jama Masjid on Friday against alleged inflammatory remarks by suspended BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma and expelled head of Delhi BJP's media unit Naveen Kumar Jindal on Prophet Muhammad. According to Jama Masjid's Shahi Imam, no call for protest was given by the mosque committee. Police said they've removed the protestors from the area.

341.title: PFA reveals Premier League Team of the Year, Cristiano Ronaldo included
341.article_body: The Professional Footballers' Association (PFA) revealed the Premier League Team of the Year, which includes Manchester United's Cristiano Ronaldo. Apart from Ronaldo, the team includes Liverpool's Alisson, Virgil van Dijk, Trent Alexander-Arnold, Thiago, Mo Salah and Sadio Mané. It also includes Manchester City's João Cancelo, Kevin De Bruyne and Bernardo Silva, and Chelsea's Antonio Rüdiger.

342.title: 30 held in Delhi for protesting against Owaisi's name in FIR
342.article_body: Delhi Police on Friday arrested 30 persons on several charges, including rioting, after they protested against the inclusion of AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's name in an FIR over alleged hate speech. The protestors gathered outside Delhi's Parliament Street Police Station. Delhi Police named Owaisi and Hindutva leader Yati Narsinghanand in an FIR registered over alleged inflammatory remarks.

343.title: Angelina Jolie to direct 'Eternals' co-star Salma Hayek in 'Without Blood'
343.article_body: Angelina Jolie is set to direct her 'Eternals' co-star Salma Hayek in her upcoming film 'Without Blood'. According to reports, the filming will take place in regions of southern Italy, as well as in Rome. Written and produced by Jolie, 'Without Blood' is an adaptation of Alessandro Baricco's novel by the same name. The film also features Demián Bichir.

344.title: I'd signed 75 films when I was 21, Dilip Kumar said 'drop 25 of them': Govinda
344.article_body: Actor Govinda has revealed that when he was 21, he had signed 75 films. He added that Dilip Kumar told him to drop 25 films. "When I told him...I'd already spent...signing amount, he said...God will ensure...I earn the money back, but that I must return...And he was right, I was falling ill...I once didn't sleep for 16 days," Govinda said.

345.title: Wind from N Korea could be carrying COVID, close your windows: Chinese city to people
345.article_body: Chinese authorities in the city of Dandong have asked people to close their windows, with officials saying that the wind from North Korea could be carrying COVID-19, according to a report by Vice News. The city of Dandong borders North Korea and is separated by a river that runs hundreds of metres wide.

346.title: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to trade below 55,000; Nifty slips below 16,300
346.article_body: Sensex fell over 1,000 points to trade at 54,299 and Nifty was lower by 284 points or 1.73% at 16,214.45 during Friday's intraday trade. Shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC), plunged 1.77% to hit an all-time intraday low of ₹709.20.
