Notably, Kotak Mahindra Bank was the top Nifty loser as the stock dropped 3.44% to ₹1,801.05.

347.title: Assam teacher sentenced to 6 yrs in prison for sexually abusing minor
347.article_body: A local court in Assam convicted a teacher for sexually abusing a minor girl and sentenced him to six years of imprisonment. It also imposed a fine of ₹10,000 on the convict. The family members of the girl had lodged a complaint with the police in February this year following the incident that took place last year.

348.title: 5 people dead, 1 injured as car falls into gorge in Nainital
348.article_body: Five people died after a car fell into a gorge in Nainital's Okhalkanda area on Thursday. Only the driver is undergoing treatment while the remaining passengers died on the spot, police said. Notably, the car was going to Gurdwara Reetha Sahib from Haldwani. Earlier on Thursday, five people died after a vehicle fell into a gorge in Tehri Garhwal, Uttarakhand.

349.title: $100 billion wiped off world's largest chipmaker's market value this year
349.article_body: About $100 billion has been wiped off the market value of the world's largest chipmaker Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) this year. The $475 billion company accounts for about 27% of Taiwan's entire equity market value, as per Bloomberg. Despite having shed one-tenth of its share value, TSMC shares are expected to surge 50% in 12 months, as per analysts.

350.title: White US policeman charged with murder of 26-year-old black motorist
350.article_body: A US police officer has been charged with murder for the fatal shooting of a Black motorist during an altercation after a traffic stop in April. Police had released videos from the incident, one of which showed policeman Christopher Schurr lying on top of the 26-year-old Congolese refugee, Patrick Lyoya, and then appearing to shoot him in the head.

351.title: Deepika visits Tirupati temple with family on father's b'day, pics surface
351.article_body: Deepika Padukone visited Sri Venkateswara Swamy Vaari temple in Tirupati on Friday, on the occasion of her father Prakash Padukone's 67th birthday. The actress was accompanied by her sister Anisha and her parents, Prakash and Ujjala Padukone. Deepika and her family had earlier visited the Tirupati temple on her first wedding anniversary.

352.title: There could be mini COVID-19 waves every 4-6 months: WHO Chief Scientist
352.article_body: As COVID-19 cases are on a rise across India, WHO Chief Scientist Dr Soumya Swaminathan has said that it could be the start of a mini wave. "The sub-variants that are emerging are more transmissible than...original Omicron BA.1 and...there's likelihood of waning immunity," she said. "There could be mini waves every four-six months...hence...it's important to...track the variant," she added.

353.title: Quite often you bluff yourself that you're not tired: Ponting on Kohli
353.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Virat Kohli, former Australia captain Ricky Ponting said, "One thing I do know...is that quite often you bluff yourself as a player that you are not actually tired." "It's not until you actually stop and have a couple of days [that] you realise how tired...you are...[This] might be exactly where Kohli is at now," added Ponting.

354.title: It's sexist: Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille dismisses rumours of dating the actor
354.article_body: Johnny Depp's lawyer Camille Vasquez has dismissed rumours claiming she is dating the actor. In an interview, Vasquez revealed that she has a boyfriend and regarding the rumours said, "It's sexist...I guess it comes with the territory of being a woman just doing her job." She also said, "I'm Cuban and Colombian...I hug everyone. And I'm not ashamed about that."

355.title: Strange creature standing on 2 legs spotted outside US zoo; pic goes viral
355.article_body: A picture of a strange creature standing on two legs outside a zoo in US' Texas has gone viral on social media. The picture was shared on City of Amarillo's official Facebook page. "The Amarillo Zoo captured a strange image outside the zoo in the dark and early morning hours of May 21," it said.

356.title: Amazon may not compete for IPL broadcast rights with Reliance, Disney: Report
356.article_body: Amazon is planning to withdraw its candidature from competing with companies like The Walt Disney Company and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries at the e-auction for the rights to telecast IPL matches to be held between 2023 and 2027, as per a report. The cost to acquire these rights could reportedly be up to $7.7 billion (around ₹60,000 crore).

357.title: Russia-occupied Mariupol at risk of cholera outbreak: UK
357.article_body: The UK Defence Ministry said that Russia is struggling to provide basic public services to the population in Russian-occupied territories in Ukraine. There is likely a critical shortage of medicines in Kherson, while Mariupol is at risk of a major cholera outbreak, the ministry added. Isolated cases of cholera have been reported in Mariupol since May, it further said.

358.title: Fitch revises India's sovereign rating outlook to Stable from Negative
358.article_body: Fitch Ratings has revised the outlook on India's sovereign rating to Stable from Negative and has affirmed the rating at 'BBB-'. "The Outlook revision reflects our view that downside risks to medium-term growth have diminished due to India's rapid economic recovery,” it said. It cut economic growth forecast to 7.8% for FY23 from the 8.5% prediction it made in March.

359.title: Hyderabad police arrest BJP leader over skit against Telangana CM
359.article_body: Hyderabad's Hayathnagar police on Friday arrested BJP leader Jitta Balakrishna Reddy over an alleged skit that made fun of Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao. An officer said that during the skit, actors used derogatory comments, made personal attacks and depicted Rao as a "boozer, cheater etc." State BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar was also booked in the matter.

360.title: India's electricity demand reaches all-time high of 2,10,793 MW
360.article_body: As per the Ministry of Power, the all India electricity demand met on June 9 clocked an all-time high of 2,10,793 MW. "The rising power demand reflects the economic growth in the country post the pandemic. The ongoing heatwave in northwest India is also a reason for the spike in demand," the ministry said.

361.title: SC dismisses pleas seeking special round of counselling in NEET-PG 2021
361.article_body: Supreme Court has dismissed pleas seeking a special stray round of counselling for vacant seats in NEET-PG 2021 All India Quota. As many as 1,456 seats were vacant after the May 7 counselling.  The quality of medical education cannot be compromised, which affects public health, SC said. The decision not to conduct fresh counselling was not arbitrary, it added.

362.title: Got De Villiers out whenever I faced him, could dismiss easily: Akhtar
362.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said he managed to dismiss AB de Villiers whenever he faced him, adding he even felt he could dismiss De Villiers "easily" at times. "When he came for [the] IPL, he tried to play the pull shot but I knew...he would be late because there was a lot of pace [in] my delivery," stated Akhtar.

363.title: Cyberabad Police warn people of fraudsters targeting verified Twitter users
363.article_body: The Cyberabad Police on Thursday warned people of fraudsters targeting newly verified profiles on Twitter. "Messages come from accounts claiming to be Twitter support. Seek the submission of documents and related details," Cyberabad Police tweeted. It further asked people not to click on any links or documents as they might include malicious spam or phishing websites.

364.title: Mithali gave Indian women's cricket a template that thousands followed: Kaif
364.article_body: After Mithali Raj announced her retirement on Wednesday, former India cricketer Mohammad Kaif congratulated the 39-year-old batter on her 23-year-long career. "Mithali Raj gave Indian women's cricket a template that thousands of girls followed. Would love to see her in a position (of) power," Kaif tweeted. Notably, Raj made her ODI debut at the age of 16 against Ireland.

365.title: Army Major cuts wife's finger over dowry in UP's Meerut
365.article_body: The wife of an Army Major has accused her husband of cutting her finger over dowry in Uttar Pradesh's Meerut. The woman told police that her husband has been harassing her mentally and physically for dowry since their marriage in 2014. The accused is posted with the Corps of Electronics and Mechanical Engineers at 510 Army Base in Meerut.

366.title: Uber is recession resistant, doesn't see a need for job cuts: CEO Dara
366.article_body: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi during an event said that the company is "recession resistant" and doesn't see a need for job cuts amid market volatility and technology companies opting for cost-cutting and slow hiring. Earlier in May, Khosrowshahi told his employees over an email that Uber will treat hiring as a 'privilege' while announcing a need for job cuts.

367.title: Jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi issued threat letter to Salman Khan: Mumbai Police
367.article_body: The Mumbai Police have said that jailed gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had issued threat letter to Salman Khan and his father Salim Khan. "Three people from his gang had come from Jalore, Rajasthan, to Mumbai to drop the letter and had met accused Saurabh Mahakal," they added. Their plan was to terrorise and extort money from them, the police stated.

368.title: RR share 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' meme after Rassie, Miller help SA defeat India
368.article_body: RR shared 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' meme after Rassie van der Dussen and David Miller helped South Africa defeat India in the first T20I. "Kabhi kabhi aisa kyun hota hai...ki apne paraye ho jaate hain (Why do sometimes our own become strangers?)" the meme read. Notably, Rassie is contracted to RR, while Miller played for RR in 2020 and 2021.

369.title: Thief hanging from railway bridge snatches mobile from moving train in Bihar
369.article_body: A video showing a thief hanging from a railway bridge snatching a mobile from a moving train in Bihar has gone viral on social media. According to local reports, the incident took place earlier this week. The incident happened on Rajendra Setu, the rail bridge connecting Patna and Begusarai, reports further said.

370.title: UN appeals for $47 mn for life-saving aid to 1.7 mn people in Sri Lanka
370.article_body: The UN and its partners have launched a joint Humanitarian Needs and Priorities Plan calling for $47.2 million to provide life-saving assistance between June and September to 1.7 million people worst-hit by the economic crisis in Sri Lanka. In total, nearly 5.7 million people need immediate life-saving assistance, UN said, adding, nearly 22% of Sri Lanka's population needs food assistance.

371.title: Rolex watch worn by prisoner during WWII 'great escape' sells for ₹1.4 crore in US
371.article_body: A Rolex watch worn by a British prisoner during the World War II "great escape" from the Nazi Stalag Luft III prisoner-of-war camp has sold for $189,000 (over ₹1.4 crore) at an auction in US. The watch was worn by Gerald Imeson on the night of March 24, 1944, when a group of Allied soldiers escaped.

372.title: Govt betraying country: Rahul Gandhi on Chinese activity near Ladakh
372.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday alleged that the Indian government is betraying the country by ignoring infrastructure build-up by China near the borders. His comments came after US General Charles A Flynn expressed concern over Chinese infrastructure coming up near eastern Ladakh, calling it "alarming". "China is building...foundations for hostile action in the future," Rahul tweeted.

373.title: China gives initial nod to revive Jack Ma-owned Ant's IPO: Report
373.article_body: China has given billionaire Jack Ma's Ant Group a tentative green light to revive its IPO, Reuters reported citing sources. Ant aims to file a preliminary prospectus for the share offering in Shanghai and Hong Kong as early as next month. However, Ant has said there was no plan to relaunch its IPO.

374.title: 3 undertrial prisoners escape Rajasthan jail using blankets; made hole in cell wall
374.article_body: As many as three undertrial prisoners, who were under judicial custody in different cases, escaped from Rajasthan's Banswara district jail on Thursday. "They jumped an inner boundary wall 12 feet tall...then the outer wall of 20 feet with the help of a rope they made with blankets," the jailer said. They made a hole in the wall of the cell.

375.title: People keep asking 'Why's he playing?': Wasim Akram on Pak's Hassan Ali
375.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said Pakistani pacer Hassan Ali starts trending on Twitter even before "he could bowl the second over of his spell", adding people keep enquiring over why he is playing. "Please stop criticising Hassan...Please give him some space," stated Akram. Hassan conceded 68 runs and went wicketless in Pakistan's first ODI against West Indies.

376.title: We didn't win West Bengal elections due to COVID-19: BJP chief JP Nadda
376.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Thursday said that his party didn't come to power in West Bengal as they failed to win the required number of seats in the 2021 Assembly elections because of COVID-19. "Due to...rise in COVID, BJP failed to campaign properly," Nadda said. "But there are more elections to come and BJP will win," he added.

377.title: Pune civic body to start night patrolling to check littering on highways
377.article_body: After receiving complaints from the residents, the Pune Municipal Corporation has decided to start night patrolling in order to monitor the dumping of garbage along the city's highways. The PMC will soon form patrolling teams and will take assistance from the police department, an official said. Notably, the residents can call on PMC's toll-free number to report such cases.

378.title: Women will come on Swayamvar for my name & fame: Mika Singh
378.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, speaking about the show 'Swayamvar - Mika Di Vohti', said, "All the girls coming on the show...know who I am and that I'm an established name." "They'll obviously come for my name, fame and there's nothing wrong with it," he added. "Even parents also look for...bride or groom who's well-settled...nobody wants their kids to marry...struggler," said Mika.

379.title: WB Class 12 board exam results declared; Adisha Deb Sharma emerges topper
379.article_body: West Bengal Council of Higher Secondary Education declared the Class 12 board exam results on Friday. Adisha Deb Sharma from Cooch Behar has emerged as the topper with 498 marks out of 500. The overall pass percentage this year has stood at 88.44%. A total of 7.4 lakh students registered for the West Bengal Class 12 board exams this year.

380.title: BharatPe founding member Nathani resigns, 3rd exit in a week: Report
380.article_body: BharatPe's founding member Satyam Nathani has resigned, making it the third exit in a week, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. Nathani's resignation comes days after Chief Revenue Officer Nishit Sharma and head of institutional debt Chandrima Dhar's reported exits. "Nathani plans to start his own venture after leaving BharatPe," a source was quoted as saying.

381.title: PMC issues notice to 3 eateries after fire at terrace restaurant
381.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Thursday issued notices to three restaurants and bars after a fire gutted a terrace restaurant in Aundh a day earlier. "When the restaurants cover the terrace or construct something, it's illegal," a PMC executive engineer said. The civic body is also checking fire brigade and building permissions for rooftop restaurants following the fire incident.

382.title: Wipro CEO becomes highest paid CEO in Indian IT sector with ₹79.6 cr pay in FY22
382.article_body: Wipro CEO Thierry Delaporte's annual salary for FY22 came to $10.5 million (₹79.6 crore), making him the highest paid CEO in India's IT industry. Delaporte's annual salary was ₹64.3 crore ($8.7 million) in the financial year 2020-21. Meanwhile, Infosys CEO Salil Parekh's pay was $10.2 million in FY22 and HCL's C Vijayakumar made $4.15 million during the same period.

383.title: Can't ask them to drop Rohit Sharma or KL Rahul and make me play: Ishan Kishan
383.article_body: Opener Ishan Kishan, who scored 76(48) against South Africa in the first T20I, said that he won't ask for opening spot when Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul are in the team. "I can't ask them to drop them and make me play. I will keep doing my thing...and I will give my best whenever I get my chance," he added.

384.title: Man gets 3 weeks bail to take care of pregnant live-in partner in Delhi
384.article_body: Delhi High Court granted interim bail for three weeks to a man to take care of his pregnant live-in partner. "Considering...except for her grandparents, who are in their nineties, there's no one to take care of the co-accused...applicant is admitted to interim bail," HC said. The couple had been booked for possession of fake identity cards of RAW and IB.

385.title: Arjun Kapoor shares childhood pic with Sonam on her b'day, pens note
385.article_body: Arjun Kapoor on Thursday took to Instagram to share a childhood picture with Sonam Kapoor on the latter's birthday. "This photo sums us up perfectly...you the bashful one and me the thinker," Arjun wrote, adding, "Times flown by...but we haven't changed just grown up I guess...from us being kids to you having one of your own now...always proud of you."

386.title: HIV-infected trio snatch chains, spend money on sex workers in B'luru; caught
386.article_body: Three HIV-infected chain snatchers who allegedly sold gold chains and spent the money on sex workers in Bengaluru and other luxuries have been caught, police said on Friday. The accused established physical relations with sex workers without informing the latter about being infected with HIV, as per the investigation. A search has been launched to identify affected women, police added.

387.title: 1st sharpshooter arrested in Sidhu Moosewala killing
387.article_body: Harkamal Ranu, one of the eight sharpshooters who allegedly opened fire on Punjabi singer Sidhu Moosewala, was arrested by Punjab police on Friday. The arrest of Ranu, who belongs to Bathinda, was confirmed by his family. Moosewala was shot dead on May 29 in Punjab's Mansa district.

388.title: U'khand cricketers got ₹100 as daily allowance, board spent ₹35 lakh on bananas: Report
388.article_body: Uttarakhand cricketers have been given a daily allowance of ₹100 for the last 12 months despite it being around ₹1,500-₹2,000, as per a report. The state cricket board had reportedly spent ₹35 lakh on bananas and ₹22 lakh on water bottles for the financial year ending March 31, 2021. Uttarakhand recently lost in the Ranji Trophy quarter-final against Mumbai.

389.title: AIMIM to vote for MVA in RS polls in Maha to defeat BJP: AIMIM MP
389.article_body: AIMIM MP Imtiaz Jaleel has tweeted that the party will be voting for Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) in the Rajya Sabha elections in Maharashtra "to defeat BJP". However, he said that AIMIM's "political/ideological differences...will continue with Shiv Sena" which is part of the MVA. "We laid certain conditions related to the development of our MLAs' constituencies," he added.

390.title: Goa govt issues notice to hotels owned by Congress MLA Michael Lobo
390.article_body: The Goa government has issued show-cause notices to two properties owned by Congress MLA Michael Lobo. According to Town and Country Planning (TCP) Minister Vishwajit Rane, there have been gross violations of law in the construction of the two hotels in Calangute. The government has sought a reply within seven days failing which the illegal structures will be demolished.

391.title: When Shreyas dropped me, I knew I had to make India pay: Van der Dussen
391.article_body: South Africa's Rassie van der Dussen, who was his team's top-scorer with 75*(46) in the first T20I against India, said he knew he had to make India "pay" after being dropped by Shreyas Iyer. He scored 45 runs off next 15 balls which included 22 runs off Harshal Patel's third over. The batter scored at a strike rate of 163.04.

392.title: BJP should look after their house; we will win 3 RS seats: Ashok Gehlot
392.article_body: On the day of polling for the four Rajya Sabha seats from Rajasthan, CM Ashok Gehlot has said that Congress will win three Upper House seats. "We are winning comfortably and it's the BJP who should look after their house. The way they fielded another candidate (Independent candidate Subhash Chandra) was not liked by even their party MLAs," Gehlot said.

393.title: US military aircraft crashes in desert; 2nd incident in 2 days
393.article_body: A US Navy helicopter crashed on Thursday near the California desert site where a day earlier a Marine Osprey went down, killing all five people aboard. "All four...aircrew on board survived the crash and have been safely recovered," the US Navy said. The MH-60S Seahawk crashed while conducting a routine training flight from Naval Air Facility El Centro, it added.

394.title: Twitter tests new shopping feature 'Product Drops' on iOS devices in US
394.article_body: Twitter has announced that it is testing a shopping feature called 'Product Drops' on iOS devices in the US. With this feature, merchants will be able to tease and promote new product launches while shoppers will see a 'Remind me' button that will notify them of the product launch and provide all other relevant details about the item.

395.title: Thailand 1st Asian country to legalise marijuana consumption; smoking still banned
395.article_body: Thailand legalised the growing of marijuana and its consumption in food and drinks on Thursday, the first Asian country to do so. However, smoking pot is still against the law. Thailand, which has a tradition of using cannabis to relieve pain and fatigue, legalised medicinal marijuana in 2018.

396.title: Mumbai boy jumps in front of train after being asked to focus on studies
396.article_body: A 16-year-old boy was killed after he jumped in front of a train between Kandivali and Malad railway stations in Mumbai on Wednesday night. The police found a suicide note wherein the boy claimed that he was being pressured by his parents to concentrate on his studies. However, no case has been filed against the parents, a police officer said.

397.title: Disha Vakani will not return as Dayaben in 'Taarak...', confirms producer
397.article_body: Producer Asit Kumarr Modi has confirmed that Disha Vakani will not return as Dayaben to his show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'. "Dayaben, the character, is all set to return but it's not Disha Vakani. Auditions for Disha's replacement are on and there will be a new actress coming in as Dayaben soon," Asit said in an interview.

398.title: Police busts insurance fraud gang in Noida, 4 held
398.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police have busted an insurance fraud gang which was claiming money from victims on the pretext of reviving the latter's lapsed insurance policies. The gang was operating from a commercial hub in Noida's Sector 18, police said. The four suspects, which include two women, are identified as Shobhit Gupta, Bharti Rajput, Islam Khan and Priti.

399.title: My diabolical plan: Musk on spoof article on Tesla cars forcibly taking staff to work
399.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk while replying to a spoof article that claimed Tesla employees' cars will now drive them to work against their will, said "My diabolical plan is coming together!" The spoof article was published by The Babylon Bee, a satire website. Earlier, Musk had told Tesla employees that remote work is no longer acceptable in the company.

400.title: BJP MLA's daughter misbehaves with police after her car stopped in Bengaluru
400.article_body: Karnataka BJP MLA Aravind Limbavali's daughter Renuka has been accused of misbehaving with the traffic police after her car was stopped and she was fined for a traffic rule violation in Bengaluru. "Do you know Aravind Limbavali? I am his daughter. That's all," she told the traffic police. Reportedly, she also manhandled the media persons who were recording the video.
